Fine company with good benefits and management support. Great team working environment and career growth potential. Exciting group of individuals ready to support all programs.

Lots of very smart, very driven people, but don't expect a lot in the way of support or training unless you're hired directly out of undergraduate.  You're dropped in and expected to know exactly what to do, and how.  And be prepared for lots of bureaucratic inertia.
Good pay. Lots of jobs. good benefits.
Exceptional Place to work, it was nice having the 9/80 schedule. They have a fitness center and a Cafe. The cubes are quite specious and they value everyone input.
Working for NG is great!  I am paid fairly, offered challenging work projects and am aligned to some of the greatest leaders in my industry.  My manager cares about my results and wants me to grow.

I was hired as an integration engineer on a contract that did not provide much mentorship or growth opportunity.  The role I was brought in to perform was easily a job, and after a few months required a transfer within the department to continue to grow/mentor me in skills that would afford me depth in the company and challenge my skill sets.  After many conversations and meetings a good fit was never found, and I ultimately moved on.
Best management and leadership team I have ever worked for or with.  Great team, we are all willing to assist each other in learning things we are not proficient in.  Great comradery too.

Northrop Grumman employs some of the most intelligent minds of our time. Growth and learning at this company are in consistent flow, and there's rarely a boring day, especially if you're a team player. There is also a clear culture of inclusion and employee/workplace happiness and excitement here.
My day to day work was I should not have lift some many boxes I would still be there. I learn new job task my co workers and manager they where and ok the culture is okay.
Great place to work. retired 2005 after 17 years. Managers were great all people I worked with were exceptional and professional. If they have jobs that you can qualify for go for it.

This job was outstanding,good people. The work is was easy, and easy to do. The job is military related helping servicing members and squadrons over seas have successfull mission by aiding them with material needed.
Would love another opportunity to work for this company again. Great people, excellent values, and above average salary. I learned much; which I enjoyed.
NG is a great company to work for if you are associated to a program. There are a few divisions, and some are better at placing employees at risk than others.
Many layoffs, not a company that truly embraces diversity and inclusion. Tremendous amounts of leadership churn which leads to a disconnected workforce and inconsistency in processes.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
I like the opportunities presented by the company through different sectors. Also, they offer education aid to further academic goals. Small task teams to perform jobs.

Good company. Like many companies these days management struggles with accountability. Compensation and benefits are good. Challenging work that protects our country. Very flexible work schedule. Engagement is encouraged and expected. Elements of management are weak and lacking leadership.
Everyday there is something else to do. Company hires within except HR takes a little bit longer than usual to call you. Overall great company to work for.
I enjoy working there as an Engineer. My colleagues are great people to be around with including management. Very relaxed environment. The benefits that are included are excellent.
This was a great place to work, good management and great coworkers.  Work life was ok but deadlines were stressful but not too bad.  I only left for the promotion potential at another company.
Outstanding in every way. Critical service for the security of our country. Very proud of the work we did and proud of the company for always putting the warfighters first!
Work-life balance has improved. Overall it's a good company. They do train and try to sustain employees. With what is going on today they have a challenge.
Great company to work for, it offers great opportunities to grow within. Flexible work schedule, the benefits are amazing. They have several locations to relocate.
Very safety orientated... If u dont fit in your not in... They been working together for years ... So your replaceable  shifts will not change politics are horrible

A typical day at Northrop Grumman consists of many meetings and lost of work at the computer. Although you get to see and be a part of cool things, you often work very hard and are given tons of responsibilities. Overall its a good company for those willing to work hard for their money. Good pay and lots of good benefits.

I love the people I work around. We are more like family and not co-workers. A typical day at work consist of on the computer, doing research. My new manager is very helpful and wants to see me achieve my goal.
I have worked at Northrop GRUMMAN FOR 10 YEARS. good job, defense contractor. lots of different programs. different locations. lots of travel, diverse workplace.
Lots of dynamic situations and a quickly moving environment, good opportunity to network and see different aspects of the cleared industry and what is involved in supported large projects.

I find Northrop Grumman Corporation is best company to work for. They have so much work that people go in work as young energetic and before they know the employee is ready to retire. High employee retention policy. They do respect their employees - management can be a little difficult to deal with time to time. Over all the company is be one of the best to work for.

I worked at Northrop Grumman for over 30 years until my retirement and I have always considered that NGC as a leader in management excellence for all its employees to be successful and duly rewarded for their hard work.

Brought in to help on the proposal for the next contract on the facility.  My peers and the larger group were great to work with and the work was challenging.  My manager and peers were always happy to help and took the time to make sure all questions were answered while also trusting me to do my job.  Unfortunately, there was not enough work to justify keeping me on board through the announcement of who won the proposal.  I keep in touch with my manager and have used her as a reference since then.

Challenging environment and fantastic people. Learned lots about sprints. Management extremely qualified and professional. The workplace was a great atmosphere and comfortable. My job had some hurry-up and waiting. It was a very collaborate environment encouraging learning and improved performance and effective communications.
Company really goes out of their way to ensure employees are happy. Movement in both location and job type is available. Appears to be lots of upward mobility.
Very busy work environment requiring ability to interface with many skill levels and personalities. Excellent opportunity for career advancement and education reimbursement.

Secure company to work for just need to work on compensation. Company paid 100% of employees going back to school of which is a good benefit.  Allowed employees to move to different groups to increase experience.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.

The organization has a really good platform. Great benefits and offers room for growth.  Local leadership has plenty of room for improvement.  Lack of effective oversight in day to day operation of why they may experience high turnover.

Long work hours. I learned alot about various computer systems and the inner workings of avionics. The workplace has alot of competition. Very busy. The hardest part of the job was advancement. Most enjoyable part was the things i learned.

Excellent work-life balance. Not a fan of the lack of direction for mid-level managers. Overall, a great company. However, there is a bit of a disconnect between the upper echelon management and the folks that are "doing the job" at the user level. However, there is almost no pressure.
poors management makes it a nightmare to work there. Alot of in house bickering and pettiness. Long hours standing on your feet with little reward or relief.

If you are looking for a job with a lot of labor, this is a great job! Great selection of hours, great benefits. Keep your head in the game that this is work and not Highschool and you will succeed and move up fast!
Loved the people i worked with but management was terrible. The company itself was fantastic and i believe in the mission but we changed management 3 times in 3 years.
I've worked at three different NG locations and I feel managers want employees to advance their careers. I appreciate the performance review methods and the competitive salary.
Good place to work, potiential opportunities to grow. Good team member, management. Leader listen to worker with good job security and future career..

Clean , well climate controlled .Little expense spared on providing tools and means to complete a job or project . Very professional professional culture with little drama. Great engineering team and support.

Depending on your position, you will be working far more than 40 hrs a week.  I am expected to be on call and checking emails and messages 24-7.  This makes having time to relax and recharge impossible.

You are surrounded by great people in all areas of the CRF, everyone is really nice. However this job is very tedious. We do a lot of work for the pay. Don't expect to move up unless you have the past experience or are willing to get a certification for everything, proving yourself through hard work doesn't count for a whole lot. Management in the other buildings should have been fired years ago, its embarrassing to know that he represents us.
The company is extremely diverse. Results oriented but people first. I had the opportunity for early advancement and career growth during my time at Northrop Grumman.

I started as a contractor to Northrop Grumman. I was identified as a potential direct hire within the first 2 years of my employment. I received consistent raises, performance bonuses, nd recommended for progressive responsibilities. It had a diverse culture of men, women, ethnicities, and ages but mentors are needed.
Northrop was great. I realized they really dont have your back. 11 years and they dont help find work when your contract funding ends. I loved it until this.

So much varies by which team you support. You can have an amazing or miserable experience. I would suggest that anyone applying take your time and ask as many questions as possible before joining a team.

this company is more worried about its cost and schedule then it is about the health and safety of its employees that work under it. They will purpose find a way to terminate you if you do not work there 24/7 work schedule
Pay is great but the work environment is terrible. They care about nothing but getting that next shipment done. No room for advancement and the union isn't much help either

I help build the B-2 Stealth Bomber the first 15. I’m very proud of that. I also helped build the F-18  Hornet. I was the head of the Employee involvement Program. Northrop flew me to St. Louis to personally fly in the F-18 Hornet. That was the Highlight of my career at Northrop Grumman.
They encourage a certain bro culture that discriminated heavily against minorities. They encourage a culture of sabotage and negligence. It’s disappointing to say the least.

The management is run by the 'good ol' boys' network. If you're a sexy young thing, you'll get the perks. If you do your work, carry your load, and the load of the sexy young things, you may get a thank you.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.

I'm continually surprised how many people don't know where company policies are that would tell them how to do basic job functions, like how to use a certain in-house software. After working here for over a year, I still don't know where to find that guidance either. The reasoning behind every decision is "that's how we did it before". Not a good environment for an engineer that likes engineering. More of an environment for someone who realized too late that they didn't actually like engineering but couldn't switch majors. Also, it's widely known that they don't fire employees, so there are many, many people that are very bad at their job, and have been for 20+ years that continually get satisfactory performance reviews. Very demoralizing place to be.
Had it not been for medical reasons I would still be there. It was a pleasure to go to work everyday and work alongside fellow workers - who now are friends.
I enjoy my Job at Northrop Grumman, but due to current situations, I am in need to find a new job elsewhere whether it be in the company or somewhere new.

Intailly, working there is exciting, offers alot to learn and very innovative. But after learning specific area of work, very little room to grow to other job departments, may be pigeon holed to just your job. Very hard to move upward, and little incentive with the amount of pay given. To offset, they do offer continuious OT.

Personally, my group was great to work with!  My manager was awesome, to work with, as well.  Within my group at Northup Grumman, we were all a cohesive team, that worked to complete our contract with the State of Arkansas.
It's a fun atmosphere with opportunities for growth. Northrop Grumman gives ample opportunities for learning and education. I am glad I made the decision to work for this innovative company

I would love to get the opportunity to continue my carrier in the UAV industry and work with the military companies to help our fighting soldiers. I have come a long way since i have started working at Northrop Gruman i have acquired  some certificates that help me do my job at 100 percent customer satisfaction.

Northrop is a great place to work because of the challenging projects and the autonomy given to employees that allow them to develop. There are opportunities to move around in the company. Flexible work arrangements are one of the benefits I enjoy personally. The pay is competitive with the market, so that is always a plus.
Best company I have ever worked for, pay, benefits, and staff are amazing.
Is a great place to work. They make you feel like a family. Met many great people and good friends. Will miss working there with everyone. They work well with your life outside of work.
Educational hands on work experience daily.  Always a sense of accomplishment at the end of the work day. Environment fostered help with tools and instruction manuals.
Northrop Grumman is a good place to work, with great benefits, job security, and great personnel.  I happy at my job everyday and found a great home!!
The company doesn't have a clear vision regardless of what the CEO believes.  The equipment and programs are antiquated.

a great learning experience for me, getting some experience working in an engineering environment and learning from the amazing people at AOX. Over the course of two months I learned so much and completed so many tasks that I am very grateful for.

If you want to be an intern at Northrop Grumman it will probably be a useless experience. Since the company deals with lots of information regarding the country's safety and security it took around 2 months for me to even get access to the computers because they had to do a thorough background check on me, and even then I didn't have access to any of the systems. Thus, I just sat with others on my team and was bored to death the entire time.
NG has provided a largely positive work experience offering me an opportunity to continue to work on military aircraft and contribute to mission success.
Great corporation, takes care of employees. Conducted Criminal History Record Searches and Child Registry investigations for prospective new hires.
Lake City Ammunition plant is a Neat place to work and when I first started, it was a great place to work.  However, over time--it progressively got worse.

Lake City Ammunition plant is a Neat place to work--but the Management styles of Northrop Grumman was not ideal.  They do not promote according to your Skill set or experience--instead, they promote by who you know and favoritism.
I have loved working for Northrop for 10 years. Great benefits, great pay and some of the absolutely most professional people I have had the privilege to work with.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Competitive working environment. Interesting technical assignmentst to work on.   Many opportunities to learn new skills.  Location is is to drive to.
I will not specificy in fairness to the overall corporation as there are many different sections throughout the world nor for the reviewers as it wouldn't be a fair assessment.

Lots of Matlab and simulation.  Tight schedule.  Turnover rate is high but the management is good.  Nice weather in California but the traffic, extremely high cost of living and the crime rate were too much for me.
Adequate compensation
I enjoyed my work, but was never paid what I was promised; I was never given full time and benefits, like I was promised; and I was laid off when NG lost the contract.
Pros- Work/life balance- very flexible and understanding.  Education assistance- excellent program
I really have nothing to say about the work we did.  It was inspired to be sure and I learned massive amounts of new information, techniques, and processes.

It's a very dynamic environment. People are always moving around, changing positions. There is also a lot of indecision and changes in direction that can be difficult to keep up with. Overall, the pay is not bad and the people are decent. It's not a bad place to work.
Engineering is hard work regardless of the employer.
Overall great place to work. Safety culture is established- as are the programs.  Work life balance is fantastic and flexible work schedules are amazing.
It's a fun workplace environment. I felt comfortable working here. I learned a lot from technical aspects up to communication, teamwork, and process improvement.

Great place to work, they care about their people, great opportunities. World wide company, Provide training to assist in advancing in your career. Leadership is inspiring. They promote great team work.

Never had any problems with this company.  Always treat their employees fairly. Management was respectful to employees.  The starting wages are very competitive in comparison to other companies in the KC metro area.

Great opportunities on various programs and divisions in the company. Opportunities abound to work on unclassified and classified programs and stretch assignments. Flexible work schedules allow you the flexibility to succeed and still have quality time with family.
The project was specifically centered on the employment of a software system for personnel travel activities that encompassed the total aspects of travel and settlement for travel expenses.

It is about who you know or related to not what you know, a bit racial ( will get promoted easily if you are an Hispanic) lots of husbands of office workers work in the tool crib, brother of lead for the tool crib works in there as well as a level 4, big $$$ .. but other than that it is a great place to work, lots of opportunities for growth in Palmdale location.
This job carried its challenges. You must maintain a close observance of guidelines and attention to detail.  Staff is highly professional and requires of you a high level of commitment.
Northrop Grumman is a great place to work.  They take care of you and your family. They have many locations to work such as California, Florida, Texas, Utah and Colorado to name a few.
Great company with benefits. I have been with Northrop Grumman for 16 years and it really has treated me well and has reached me cutting edge technology!
worked 65 miles from plant mgr didn't want any days available to work from home.  taking PTO, not encouraged

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
A definite schedule was laid down, daily status and demands were made. Persons not producing were fired.

NGC in Melbourne is rapidly expanding and has many openings for entry to mid level engineers. There campus is new and there are many openings internal and external. Overall the people are great to work with and the culture is very positive.

As a cybersecurity policy writer, I was told not to engage in meetings or step out of my place. The whole team was told not to actively engage with each other. Our manager was subsequently let go, but many months of a difficult environment first.

Most of the time the management wants you to sit around and listen to their stories, play their games and kiss their rings. They are more focused on making people like and respect them than they are actually getting work done.
Very interactive environment; continuously sharing ideas and having ideas bounced off of me.

Northrop Grumman is a great company to work for. There are wide ranges of work, development and leadership opportunities if a person is open to travel or relocation, is willing to learn new skills, and is willing to invest in self-development.

Very abusive environment. Employees are encouraged to verbally slander and attack other employees.  Employees are worked to the point of exhaustion without compensation.  Managers falsely promise promotions and raises and then lie about it when they don’t come through, they claim they never promised anything,  people are demoted for nepotism and lied  to by senior management.
They are flexible with working hours that fit into your schedule and with working from home if needed. Everyone is nice and there is good work life balance.

You'll have so many bosses that you'll never feel job security. Be sure not to burn any bridges with anyone while working there! Most of the people I worked with were amazing! Also, don't expect any kind of significant raises while working there.
I’ve had the opportunity to supervise 5 employees, and train them in the propulsion shop. I’ve exercised my knowledge and skills to provide a quality product to the customer on a timely manner.

If you like being micromanaged this is the place for you. Your job will require constant staus updates and a management team that is scared of the Vice President. If your on good terms with the VP, then you will be ok, otherwise cya later.
Enjoyed my life at Northrop the interaction with all the suppliers and the military personnel was very rewarding and a learning process at the same time

The work is fairly easy and the pay is good, every other Friday is off so that's nice.  If you're looking to raise a family and live life this is a good company to settle down with.  If you're looking to advance your career and knowledge, keep looking.
I am a technical illustrator and I work with wonderful technical writers and management who keep me busy all the time! Love this place.
NG has and remains an amazing company to work for. The work is exciting and is equally challenging. There are always opportunities if you know where to look.

The pay is good and so are the benefits. The people I work with are very helpful and all of them are consummate professionals. The finest machinists I have ever worked with, although some of the inspectors are a bit light on their work ethic. That's talking about the Union people. The management by and large leaves something to be desired. Only thing is most of the tools were made before I was born and sometimes that's all you've got. Yet we make it work and hold tenths and that gives me a lot of satisfaction.
Excellent place to work, my only complaint was the salary was not what I was worth in the job market. Management was supportive and encouraging. NGC offers good benefits at a fair price.
Great place to work positive environment great attitudes from everyone great pay benefits huge place lots of parking very helpful leads and people northrup Grumman is a great place
Lots of cost cutting in the industry and NG is no different. Look out for your own career. Not a bad place to work otherwise.. they make an attempt to do the right thing for you.

Great technical challenges, compensation, and management.  The company allows employees to move to other areas that best suits the employee. Highly recommended  for engineers looking for career growth.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.

As part of a support department, I don't have the experience around our products as much so i interface more with the beaurocratic parts of the business. Some places are great, some aren't--a lot of it comes down to who your leadership is. They can make or break your time here.
Great place to work good benefit at the time of my retirement good pension great 401k thing have changed my last few years  no pension for employees coming to work there after 2008

This job is very rewarding, withc many opportunities to grow professionally. From the CEO, to Regional Managers, to direct Managers, and fellow colleagues, this place makes you feel welcome and a part of a team.

Culture doesn't allow for creativity or differing styles--driving out the smart ones and keeping the worst on the rolls and protected.  I would run away from NGAS as soon as you can--it is getting worse especially in Dayton.  Leadership is hard to find and always from the top down and to the numbers.  A few people work 60+ hours a week to keep the wheels on and are not rewarded for it.
The management here seems to run people out of town after a while. It doesn't seem too often that you run into a manager that you want to stick around for. Too much politics.
Great company and really works for me when I, in-turn, worked for them. Family-friendly environment and the other employees really looked out for one another.
I work with a great group. The management is very family-oriented and flexible. There is room for growth and moving up in the company. They provide education benefits.

Northrup Grumman has been an ideal employer for me.  The benefits are wonderful.   The work atmosphere is very ideal.  I am compensated very well.  Love the cafeteria and they also have a very well equipped onsite gym.  Extremely clean building.
Combination of Linux, Windows Operating Systems.  Also, hardware and software installation and networking.  Terrific leaning environment.  Overall good experience.

NGIS was an amazing work environment. From management, to my constituent employees, everyone was an absolute pleasure to work for/with. The only recommendation I have is to baseline the hours you are able to work in a given period. Given the intense growth, combined with ever tightening deadlines, the work-life balance can get thrown very off. With that said, take time to speak with your management, and they will do everything possible to help assist in the management of your workload.
I loved my time at Northrop Grumman  it was the best job I’ve ever had  . It offers great opportunities to learn and advance in your career at every step.

Outstanding, the workplace culture had expectations and the ability to achieve  those expectations was assisted. I have never worked for a better company. Had the contract not ended i would still be with them.

Management was poor and most treated people as if they were stupid. They have alot of work for a few months and hire alot of people, then lay them off when the work is slow. Very high school atmosphere with gossipy cliques.
Work was different hours, not 8-5.  Some days were 18 hours a day and only 30 minutes of work. It was boring and I didn't see a long future there.  Pay could have been a lot better.
I cannot give any more detail. Thank you. Forcing this is not appropriate now is it? This section could have been made optional. And on a voluntary basis. thank you
High demand work environment based on production needs. Management was very effective empathizing with the strenous demands through the use of morning meetings

Provide training for managers especially new managers. They tend to throw new managers in management positions who are young and have never been a manager with no management training. Rules change per manager it seems
Came in as a contractor, converted to an employee and my compensation dropped substantially (took a $5.00 pay cut) to convert to an employee NOT GOOD!
Good employer to work for! Great management that supports team development. Always felt welcome and I was able to be creative and use my ideas in my position.
Large defense contractor working with global presence. High concerned for the next contract and sustainability of current products as well as future developments.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
The good thing about this company is it can be flexible for work/life balance and offers good benefits. One negative thing is the company compensates external hires more highly than internal hires.
I liked the  day to day challenges, and friendships i have built there.
I had one of the best supervisors when I worked for Northrup Grumman. She never put limitations on your growth potential. she would encourage learning.
Excellent company.  Great benefits, love the support from management.  Very family oriented.  The only problem is the length of contracts.  Most jobs are located in the east and wesf coast.
I enjoyed my time with Northrop but being a contractor your job can end at the drop of a hat. I'm just waiting for the hammer to drop and for them to send me home.

Although work advancement is supported, there is massive chaos starting with reporting lines. This could, and most likely would, result in the employee directly reporting to someone offsite who they do not know and seldom see. It leads to confusion as to who is giving direction and who has authority. The amount of chaos is driving employees out and leads to many tasks being dropped especially when positions are not re-filled.

Cutting edge military technology  Space innovations  two annual bonuses already  Superior benefits over all the other companies I’ve worked for   Hard fast paced work for serious professionals  Veteran friendly dinners and recognition

Worked to automate the process of reworking circuit boards for satellites as a capstone project for my senior year at UCSB. Our contacts at Northrop Grumman were great resources for the project and connections afterwards.

We have a pretty good team atmosphere.  There is a sense of belonging.  I have had the opportunity to work with different systems and projects.  It is nice to have travellled to so many different place.
Stay away from this place. What is this? I don't want to fill this out; indeed sucks as well. Northrop Grumman is not what I was expecting; false advertisement.
What it says on the tin.
Highly skilled workers some people are friendly while others are not . Remain focus and give it your all. I was a contractor there. Alot of modification to Aircraft.
Tons of work, very little work/life balance. Pationate and dedicated employees with a commitment to the job. Amazing technology and you work with very intelligent people.
Management interacts well with staff, typical day starts up fast, especially in the morning. Having a café and lounge for all to access is a complement for this company.
Management offers the chance for advancement. Flexible workplace. For the most part, you will remain busy all day. Friendly coworkers and a family atmosphere.
Typical big company experience. If you were aligned with the right supervisor, things went well. Depending on the project, you could do well or not. I'm not a big company person.

I enjoyed my workload and my work schedule.  The toughest part was dealing with the different people that were very unreceptive to change.  I was in the military for a long time and its hard for me to deal with people that don't have self-motivation.  It is only a few people but it is those few that can change dynamics of a team.  But all in all, we still got the job done.

Like all Aerospace companies they are constantly re-inventing themselves. I don't always like what they come up with, but the management is cognizant about their place in the DOD market and is trying to be a Top Performer. Their history is as an Integrator of Aerospace Systems and Platforms and they are constantly sending the message that the future is not like the past. Everyone needs to keep bettering themselves to make a difference. I've worked at eight (8) Aerospace companies in my career and NGC is about as good as you will find in the industry.
NG is a dynamic and diverse place to work.  Culture and way of doing business is always challenged to ensure we are meeting our customer where they are and when they need us.
NG allows movement for career growth and supports employee development. Me and so many other talented people left because of bad location (CA). I would go back in a heartbeat but not to CA.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Good company with a large portfolio of programs.  Competitive benefits.  Company continues to grow and expand product offerings.  Traditional defense industry work environment.

Work load was so heavy during my time at NG that I managed one vacation in 5 years (additional vacation requests were denied due to no back-up).  I regularly worked 85-95 hour pay periods (with no compensation for hours over 80).  Additional tasking was added to my workload with no additional compensation, and when I pushed back I was told I was lucky to have a job and I wouldn't have a job for much longer if I refused the additional work.
People are great.  Job and hours are exceptional.  Pay is good for the job and location.  Benefits are great. People work to complete the task and work together well.
Working 9 hour days Monday-Thursday is great because you get every other Friday off. The on-Friday is only an 8 hour day. This gives you flexibility of 3-day weekends half of the year!
Good people to work with. Management is good nice place to work at. Multiple locations. Northrop Grumman is a large company and can move around if necessary.

As a company as a whole its a great place to work but there is not that much room to advance. The company tends to promote people that come from the outside instead of within and that the downside of working there.

The management, with a few exceptions, has an elitist mindset. They expect you to know exactly the same things they do and if you don't, they look down on you and either give you busy work that has nothing to do with your job, or they pass you over for any work.

Northrop Grumman acquired Orbital ATK a year and a half ago and they are still working through the transition to the Northrop way of doing things. The procurement team has a diverse mix of great of people.

Not very flexible. They claim to offer education assistance for grad school but getting funding over 10k per year is near impossible. Managers don't take interest in how employees feel or their personal life, it just about the bottom line.
I  worked with great people.  They are intelligent and great team players.  We were able to work together to solve problems and accomplish our goals on the projects.
I felt most of the employees wanted to come to work and wanted to do a good job for the company and the customer.  NGC was a great place to work for the most part.
Good work flow. Consistent supervision updates on jobs. Daily meetings with management in the morning before work starts. Ability to learn several different processes every other day.

Many projects give limited time to complete, forcing overtime to be done. Benefits are removed frequently. Sick time taken away, forced to use vacation. Vacation time taken away. Higher education support reduced. Health insurance continually becoming more and more expensive, 10x more expensive in 4 years. No more bonuses for hard work.
NG has a very stable environment for employees who want to learn and grow their careers.  The best company I have ever worked for.  I would highly recommend working at NG.
The company makes attempts to listen to its employees and tries to engage them in making it a better place to work. Some say with mixed results but at least they are making the effort.

Overall, the company isn't that bad. Culure is clickly, managers are hit and miss and they are stretched thin on tasks, the pay sucks. I was in finance/business management and my salary sucked. I referred a friend into the engineering group and his salary didn't match the work he was doing. I had few other friends in different areas who too had lower than average salaries.

It is well understood among those in the management ranks that females and African Americans are given such preference for promotions to director and above that white males often need not apply, even when their education, experience, past performance, and other qualifications makes them unquestionably the best candidate.  All management employees with enough time at the company can give many examples where this has occurred.  As a result of not selecting the best candidates for upper management and executive roles for the last 5-10 years, the competency level at those ranks has dropped precipitously.  I no longer consider Northrop Grumman a well managed company because the number of incompetent directors and vice presidents has risen to the point in which they are a significant portion of the total.

The contract I was on had a horrible assistant project manager, and the mid level management suffered from it greatly. I understand a company as a whole cannot be fairly judged on one person's performance, and as I do not hold Northrop as a whole accountable for that, I do hold the management above him that kept him in place accountable.  Northrop is a wonderful company, and their projects are admirable, but that APM was horrid.
Multiple programs allow plenty of room to move around the company and gain new experiences and lots of opportunity to move up to roles of greater responsibility.

All my coworkers made for a fun environment. As for as learning goes, it does get stale and lots of delay between each task which wasn't fun for me because I like to be kept busy. Hardworking manager but feel like tasks could be delegated a little better.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Great Opportunity but long time team members lacked College Degrees while their job required that they have one. Lack of communication within the department I was in.

You have to be an engineer to really matter in this company. The pace in this place is typical; 9-5 and nothing exciting ever happens. The place claims to care for their employee's, but when it comes to regular employee's who are not engineers; the management sure make it hard to move forward.
Some of the previous nature of Orbital still exists and is slow to change.  Bur we are in a new building and some changes although slowly are happening,
Great place to work, team environment very solid workforce. Worked here for years and they have provide a great growth system that allows each person to move in a path for success.
A good paying job  with good people  from lots of different backgrounds. Company has a positive mission to help our troops and they make everyone feel they are part of the bigger plan.

Excellent opportunities and benefits. If you work hard, you will succeed. Many opportunities to advance and further your career personally and professionally. Strong sense of family and taking care of your people.
Superiors, peers and subordinates were nearly 100% prior service military making it an excellent fit for me and my knowledge, skills and abilities.  Great benefits and room for growth.
NGC was a good company to work for. Company did well at contract end to try and place employees within the local area. Overall good company to work for.
good place to work for once you are in they take care of you.  able to work in an environment that the people take care of one another along with management.
The work environment is very friendly and workers are valued for their individual roles.  Superiors and managers genuinely care about their employees.
I love working at NGC, the culture is great here. This company really likes to invest in their employees career development which is great.
The hardest part of the job is travel. This job requires about 17 weeks of travel every year. The most enjoyable part of the job is working with soldiers and my peers.

Overall, Northrop Grumman is a good employer. The salary and benefits are competitive and they are sincere about having work-life balance.  Employee turnover seems to be reducing cutting into legacy work culture. Work with some fine people.

Northrop Grumman is an older company, so with that comes a lot of paperwork, processes, red tape, and slow changes. On the other hand, management makes their best effort to provide lots of career opportunities for all employees.

The company offered a 9/80 work schedule, which is great. They offer flexible work hours and telecommuting. There are layers of bureaucracy in management which makes it difficult to enact change. The most enjoyable part of the job is working on the incredible projects and programs.
See above. We were always waiting for the next contact, which I understand is not uncommon in the airspace and defense sector. I enjoyed the people very much.

A driven, motivated team player with over 20 years of experience in automotive repair and over fifteen years of experience with troubleshooting and repairing manufacturing equipment and preventive maintenance. Highly motivated and dedicated with a commitment to create and maintain a safe working environment.
I think "fun" would be the last word to describe the office culture of NGC. It's very conservative and formal.  Old school perspectives and traditional ways of thinking are prominent.
Has ups and downs. Very little stress most of the time, but little incentive to do more than required. Working for the military also comes with a hit to your conscious.
A large company that made every employee feel like they matter.  Challenging yet rewarding work.  Management was supportive and I was always treated fairly.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Limited time there not as an employee. Different view on how the company is. For the most part everything is fine and is dependent on the individual working there. It's a good option overall.

i currently work for them at northdrop gruman and it is horrible and truly disorganized on a massive scale currently my schedule is 6 days a week with 9 to 10 hr days with a 5am call time and they use the fact that your a temp to take advantage of you
The workplace culture at Northrop Grumman is nice, met a lot of good friends, and learned a lot. While at Northrop Grumman I not only met good people, I got to work on a lot of exciting projects.
Day at work is pretty awesome because always a new thing to learn and develop capacity to make the work better.
Nice place to work, nice people and lots to do. Benefits are not the best. Great for work/ life balance. They focus on individuals with a degree, some situations this is more harmful than good...

There are times where you feel that the company doesn't really care about you. It can be very demanding physically. There used to be a lot of room for advancement and growth but they have stopped that and now it is very difficult to go up in the company.
People are smart and easy to work with. The scrum master is very understanding of when you take time off and almost always get approved when you have doctor appointment or anything.

I was shoved in last minute, so I don't blame them for me not having much to do. I spent most of my time making sure things were up to date on spreadsheets and doodling on sticky notes. Paid well though.

Northrop Grumman has many good things about it. Very consistantly work, mostly competitive pay, ok opportunity to advance. I left because I maxed out the pay for my position and they said I was not eligible to promote for over a year.
The Company offers great opportunities in regards to career progression and Compensation Benefits.Provided a pleasant work environment, variety of opportunities.
Great supervisors committed to supporting the workforce and providing opportunities for advancement. Communicating overall performance and health of the company was top notch.
NG is a great place to work.   They push you to excel in all aspects of your duties.  You will be exposed to many additional tasks that allow you to grow as a person and as a professional.
Loved working as a team, being a team player. Had goals to achieve and enjoyed meeting these goals. Opportunity for learning and achieving the new assignments

Northrop Grumman is an outstanding company that values people and provides excellent career growth opportunities for those who want to work.  Management places a large emphasis on employee engagement and growth that many other companies do not.

I saw security people violate security policies. HR NEVER does their jobs. I was assaulted by a supervisor and told to not report it by another person in management. Everyone is hired via nepotism and management is chosen in a similar fashion. Internal investigations are an incompetent joke. Discrimination and racism are normalized. They screwed up my security clearance. They literally nag low level people about timecard fraud while people with seniority spend all day on Facebook in the same cubefarm. Selective policy enforcement is the norm. Theft is a regular occurrence.
Fair and rewarding and very fast paced work environment.  Management needs more skill in helping employees to achieve there goal. Job and contracting company have break down in communication.
If you want to advance your career quickly, this is the place. Great place to work and constantly innovating in the industry. Put in the hours and the over time and you will get noticed by people.
Good Opportunities, great benefits  and an enjoyable atmosphere that is very Diverse.  Learning Opportunities and lots of knowledgeable co-workers to assist you.

I got the job through a Temporary , it was a good job , I love working there , It gave me great experience and show me different things.   I had to deliver different parts to the men and women that was working on building Navy planes,I also had to do inventory to make sure all the parts I was there.
I worked for Northrop Grumman as a contractor. They are a well-organized company with competitive pay and good benefits. They know how to take care of employees.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.

Loved everyday I went to work. I felt included, accepted, challenged, and successful. The only thing that anyone could say negative is the pay vs. the cost of living. I  think if they want to keep the head hunters at bay, a bump in pay would be good.
Sr management treats employees as expendable resources to be used up and discarded rather than as assets. They embrace the mindset that beatingsshould continue until morale improves.
Worked there more than 25 years, enjoyed the technical challenges and work environment.  Travel opportunities, multiple programs, good work culture, southern California.

Someone who enjoys solving problems for a customers and giving back to the mission.  A career intelligence officer who served in the USA and other government agencies in support of national objectives.
I learned mostly about security and maintaining company based protocols. The workplace was fun but professional with management not being overbearing unless you just weren't doing your work.

The company seems to focus more on diversity and continuous turnover rather than balance and value of their senior level employees. Continuous organizational restructuring due to diversity incentives such as female leadership and younger less experienced technical work force has caused the company to fail on meeting milestone commitments. Although the company advertises and promotes diversity unfortunately this has become an internal morale problem as the senior experienced employees are no longer valued and often incentivesed to retire or seek employment outside of the company.
Large refresh project, interesting environment. Helps to have a security clearance. Some areas are classified. Nice employee outings for Holidays , barbeques etc...
Flexible schedules, remote options, and education assistance. Management is okay. This year, the company has gotten better with communicating the strategy.
All depends on what program you work for, some programs have tons of overtime mandatory and old tech, while others are totally the opposite. Culture is you have to switch roles to get promoted.

Everyone at Northrop has perfect job security (they won't fire someone unless they mess up really bad).  As a result, everyone slowly realized that they didn't have to do their job well since there is no risk to their career and no additional reward for going above and beyond.  This is not a good employer for active-thinkers or people who like to improvise.  Creativity and challenging the status quo are discouraged, though not openly.  Perfect place for someone who's at the end of their career and just needs some healthcare for a bit.
Very laid back in the program space I worked in. Management was awesome and there was plenty of help for career advancement and training. I would definitely consider going back to work for them!
Good Salary
Most of the leads know what there doing, most days it feels as if all they care about is how many job cards are closed and not as must as the quaity of work

Northrop used to have a pension, no more.  They are a huge company.  Not a lot of training support there.  Some areas are a lot better than others.  I don't recommend working there to start your career.

Support to network defense with an eight hour day with some supervisory work. I have learned to monitor networks in real-time while producing status reports and keeping leadership informed of changes. The culture is great with informal dress and an upbeat communication across the work stations. The hardest part of the job is the slow work volume at night which is not as exciting as the beginning of the shift. The most enjoyable part of the job is reacting to time-sensitive threats on the network.
No complaints an outstanding company to work with and for. Many sectors allow for transition given the required skills. Availability to excel in your career and personal life.
Great place to work,  just like any other job,  had its ups and downs... schedule is a big concern.  Company expects too many units to be completed in little time. More emphasis on quality needed

The company did a great job improving processes, best practices and training employees. There were growing pains but they pushed hard to create standard practices which made designing flow much smoother across various subsystems. However, Management's expectations were unrealistic and mandated overtime to accomplish release goals which were not possible.
Fair pay. Progressive culture. Flexible hours with some telework options. Many different potential projects for you to work on. Management is very easy to approach.
Lots of waiting for decision, looking for need material or tool or other group to complete work. it's a big place with a big goal and lots of people and groups so it's somewhat understandable.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Enjoyed the employer. Nice drive to and from work. Plenty of overtime. Depending on assigned area could see plenty of desert.   35 miles East of town.

Overall, Northrop Grumman is your average defense contractor with a similar work culture you'll find at Lockheed, Raytheon, and all others. Besides the high-end tech, what really stood out to me were the makerspaces (AKA FabLab) provided by the company. These were spaces for employees to collaborate and build anything they'd like. Northrop provided all sorts of tools and equipment and was constantly adding more stuff just so employees can continue to experiment and express their creative selves.

Northrop Grumman is a good outfit. ... In any case, Northrop is a career company. If you can work for them, it will not always be fun and there will be a fair measure of internal bureaucracy but it's going to be a forever job if you want it. And you can advance internally.

Bottom line I think they suck as an organization as a whole..  They out source their services and do not have close interpersonal relationships with their employees.  This is a very disconnected company.

The postal service is never happy no matter what and constantly changing policies and procedures .  Northrop management is inconsistent, there seems to be no common standard to follow . some managers get away with too much unprofessional behavior.
The company was a very fun place to work at. Productive and fun environment. Great company culture and job security. Depending on the location, there may be gyms and different facilities.
Working for them was fine. Expected to go to work on time everyday and do your job at a timely manner and accurately.....pay was decent and average for industry standard .
One of the best places that I have had the opportunity to work for.  I highly recommend that those exploring the job market consider potential opportunities at this company.
There is a lot of room to grow in such a large company and everyone that works there is very friendly and willing to help you out. Every other Friday is a work day off which is nice.

The company itself is progressive at the corporate level and has great pay and benefits.  There could be improvements made to increase that diversity and opportunity for advancement at their individual locations.
lot of work, but have to deal with many incompetent people.
Organized great place to work

I have been at this company for 20 years. They look out for their people. I have noticed a recent trend of hiring those right out of college.  This is how NG keeps their costs down. They are good, but they are expensive. This helps offset that.  However, they easily get rid of those that have been there for years because their salary starts getting up there. They haven't always chosen the best leaders. Senior leadership is great, but lower level leadership needs improvement.  Overall, I am very happy with NG.

I love what I do and the company as a whole, but the department management is ridiculous. There are promises made for change and nothing done; no one is held accountable and it puts a bad taste in your mouth when you work as hard as you do.
Very interesting and Challenging work. I worked with a number of engineers whom I respect very highly. Northrop Grumman is very sensitive to security and does allot of security screening to make sure
One of the best company's to work for. This company cares for there employees and the management treats there subordinates like adults. One of the best work culture.
Employees are very kind and helpful... caring each other and make sure they have the tool they needs.

There are so many different possibilities within this corporation, you just have to look for them. It maybe a lot of work but it could be worth it. There are so many different ways to improve your career, your knowledge and your salary.
Good work environment

Been with NG for almost 5 year. I'm not impressed with their management style. Working on a customer site, you're very disconnected from headquarters, so have the time you don't know what's going on the company.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Good job with little advancement opportunity. Benefits were good and people were great but management was lacking with being transparent and honest with employees.

Was a great place to work, however being denied a security clearance made it a dead end for me. Was over looked for advancement despite my work qualifications. However, I should have stuck it out instead of putting in my notice.

Very stable company with good career growth opportunity if your willing to put in the work. Merit fairly steady, promotions are where you will see a bigger jump in pay. Bonuses are sometimes offered for those who are top performers
they are a no nonsense company, they were always about the business at hand, they provided support if any employee gave you a hard time. you had opportunity to learn on the job.
Great employer to work for, new cutting edge technology. Great team atmosphere. Wonderful, great., and terrific. Not to mention having a stellar time working on military aircrafts
Northrop Grumman has provided a stable and positive environment in which to work, grow, and develop my skills as a technical writer and process analyst.
Great company. Very veteran friendly. Great pay and benefits. Challenging environments, various work locations around the globe, so international travel is required.
The company offers a broad range of work in defense contracting as well as in the commercial space sector.  Many opportunities to move around.  Benefits are typical for a company of this size.
The company pays a far wage for the type of work your conducting. Being promoted they conducted like the military style going in front of a board. Training the Saudi Arabia National Guard easy job.
It was an interesting job. The hardest part of the job is staying focused on the task at hand. It can get very monotonous and boring to sit or stand in the same spot all day.

came in did your work everyone willing to haelp if needed. Had to fix problems as well as be able to over come new problems. hardest part was never having the same problem twice so each time there was a problem it was something new
Northrop Grumman is a great company to work for. The schedule is great. We are on the 9/80 schedule, so every other week we have Friday off. Having a three day weekend twice a month is fantastic!
nothing that great depends on area of job. I was in a field where there was no actual plan for advancement. I ended up have to move to another field to ensure I was able to progress.
Stable company, good work, average benefits. I was a Cyber Systems Engineer working on an Enterprise packet network. Had the ability to use Agile applications.
Great place to work at.  I never once felt like I was an outcast, my team took me in and immediately started showing me the ropes.  This job was very satisfying.
From the manager to the security personnel, you'll be delighted by how caring the individuals are and how productive they are as a team! Very good place to work!
Excellent company and work environment, giving employees ample tools and opportunities for success!  Would definitely recommend them and consider working for NG again!
Best aviation workplace for job security compared to other companies. Easy to change programs. Good opportunities for job advancement. Don't have to deal with unions.
A phenomenal environment consisting of knowledgeable people, work-life balance, and opportunity for career advancement. There's always something to learn!

Editing documents all day long, returning emails, sending emails, answering calls, interacting with counterpart for some of the jobs sent in emails. The hardest part of this job was dealing with Management's micromanaging and doing the same thing day in day out. The culture there was like having two sides there was the Union side and the staff side even though both types of jobs needed to work together. Most enjoyable part was some of the people I worked with or met through working in different areas.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.

Everyone at Northrop was very friendly and was very close to each other, I was a contractor and they made me feel like family. They were all very welcoming and informative of what they needed and expectations while I was a contractor for them.
Great place to start your career and advancement as support always available to you! Continuous training throughout the day and lesson learned. Veteran friendly company.

Came into the company and was a little intimidated by the vastness (both its size and scope of current projects), but was immediately put at ease by a great manager who understands your needs, and is clear in outlining your expectations.
Lots of hands-on and learning/growth opportunities. It's a big company. Just have to be patient in finding the right opportunity.
Good paid vacation. Supervisors who listen.  Urgency but realistic. All employees are goal motivated. Compensation is above industry average.  Ability to advance if you pursuit the opportunity
Ok company lots of chiefs tons of overtime, and weekend work. Not a lot of support from upper management as far as training classes to do your day to day job
Great Company, plenty room to advance career. Opportunity to move around the world and states. Ability to learn more and  have a meaning behind what you do while working for Company.
Working at Lake city I’m able to make good money. The hours are good. I like working the three days and then four days the next week.

Responsibilities and expectations are high, and the pay is very low in comparison to the importance of the job.  A typical day at work...high stress and busy from the time you enter until departure, which is great as it helps time pass. Training was interesting, could use some structure. Management is ok, the culture is pretty good. There are some pretty good folks there with kind hearts. The hardest part of the job is getting through the day to day duties. The most enjoyable part...departing daily.

I have worked for 3 defense contractors now, and they are all very much the same.  The work is very stable, but depending on what team you are on, you will most likely be working with very old technology.
Edited various documents on an SSA Contract. Reviewed the format and styles for a wide variety of internal agency contracts. It was a short term project
My review at working for Northrop-Grumman is that it’s a great place to work. However I think that it could be a little more diverse and everyone doesn’t have to be just coming out of college.
Not the job to have if your lazy. Management gives you the tools to succeed. They don't have the greatest tuition reimbursement program, you are only allowed to take six credit hours per semester.
Do not want to add comments. This is not a section i chose to populate. I will not be writing about Grumman. I decline this section and do not want to give this information.
●	Upgraded systems to 2016.

Enjoyed my work at NG.  The work was exciting and fun. However, like most contracting work, the contract could be lost at any time which leaves you without a job.  This requires the employee to look for something which meets their background or become unemployed.

I've been with the company for several years now and I feel that I am part of a team. Politics seem to be minimal and the environment is positive. There are bad apples at every company and this is no different, but those are not very common with where I am at. I enjoy coming to work each day.

Your growth at the company depends on your manager and direct lead. There isn't a general training or set standard to get you up to speed. Its up to you to ask as many questions to grow in the company
great benefits, good learning experience for new skills, travel available. good people to work for. must want to continue learning and increasing civilian education.

No complaints here! Great benefits. People and pay. Northrop in my opinion values their employees. I Used to work for them 10 years ago and even then they were an amazing company. They absolutely stand by their core values and quality the first time.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
They do lots of extra curricular activities to involve the company as a whole. Wonderful place to work. Very comfortable work environment. Very proud company with strong ethnics.
Heavy workload but repetitive tasks. It is a great place to start off to gain more Human Resources experience but little room for advancement and growth
Great company to work for. They could pay better based on location but it's doable. I love working around the latest tech and some of the hardest working people.
The work schedule 9 hour days / 80 allows every other Friday off is wonderful!  Working from home is an option, the 401K matching is excellent and the PTO is exceptional.

I haven't been apart of the company for long but I have enjoyed my time since I've been here. Most of my time involves prepping and organizing company documents for my manager. This company, from my experience, has a positive workplace environment.

The company has various opportunities in various technical fields, however the management is the most significant problem within the company.  They do have good benefit programs and are great if you are entry level, otherwise most of the talented technicains and engieneers almost always leave for something better.

I enjoyed working there, great work schedule, but the pay in my area was a little weak.  I left due to salary.   A great company, with a great mission.  They prize engineers, unfournately I am not one, a great company with a very important mission nonetheless.

I enjoyed my time at NG.  Learned a lot and had the pleasure of working for a great manager.  The team she put together were very capable.  I would love to work there again if I still lived in the area.

When I joined, this facility was at least 25 years out of date on current software processes. Software, although the largest group there, gets little respect and doesn't get to control their own projects. Project Mgmt runs everything and if it isn't being paid for by the customer, it doesn't get done. Software does not get to enact process improvements unless a customer agrees to pay for it... so it never happens.
Management takes notice to those with a drive. It is not difficult to be successful for those that are diligent and take pride in their work. Apply yourself and you will succeed.

Great place to work, great benefits & adequate pay. The company will let you go as far as you can push yourself,  it is truly up to you. If you don't push yourself into lear6new skills & refuse to take advantage of all the training & development the company offers, it is easy to become stuck in the same position for years.
Great place to develop and grow in your career. I learned a lot of my time at Northrop, this was a great place to grow as an analyst and team player. Would highly recommend!

If you not part of the good ol boys club or you don't fit into their concept of operations or their way of doing things you're scrutinized, bullied until you quit or they look for ways to terminate you.
Great Company with an amazing educational program. My team members  treated each other as family. Growth within the company available, but may require relocation.

Northrop has a great culture for an Aerospace and Defense Company.  If you are looking for a place that wants to be the best and is open to new ideas on how to get there, than this is the company for you.
Know one is on the same page.  There money to be made   Plenty of room for advancement. Could be a fantastic place to work if management would get there stuff together

Overall, I was very satisfied with the work I was able to do at Northrop Grumman. I was able to move between multiple teams and contribute in fulfilling ways. The largest drawback would be the red tape, and if you're not proactive then you'll have nothing to do. My advice: ask for work if you want to work.
I’m happy to say that I was part of a Team at Northrup Grumman for 33 years. Made good friends during my time at the Company and we are still in contact today.
Very satisfying atmosphere from the interest level of the job tasks to the personality of each individual coworker.

Work can be slow and repetitive for most due to long winded programs. Lots and lots of low skill laborious tasking. Few individuals are coached for advancement. Continuous turnaround / hiring process.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Required to enter something here.  Great place to work. Great Culture. Learned a lot about business development.  Very enjoyable, good learning environment, good challenges.

I’m proud work for Northrop Grumman, nice and intelligent people, friendly environment and good healthcare benefits. Management are very good. No remote work unfortunately but this is understandable during security nature.

I like the 9/80 work schedule so that you can take every other Friday off. Also, you have flexibility to your work schedule as long as no urgent matters need your attention. Also, have opportunity to work remotely with approval from management.

In my 33 years with Northrop, my career has taken me from an N/C Programmer to Website Admin, Lead Standard Tool Designer and more.  A great place to work, where if you show incentive, take the lead on tasks, you will get noticed and promoted!
Poor supervision was not really in touch with what was going on or what the work load really about. Poor or no equipment to do job that was on hand. Poor

Good inside job for 22 years till they laid me off for no reason. Made the company a lot of money over the years and worked six days a week for the majority of my tenure there. Away from my family eighty percent of the time.
In my time there I had two managers.  My first manager was very good and a dream to work for.  My second manager was remote and not effective in the least.

NGC has a hard time placing senior people and providing fulfilling and exciting work.  I have been employed over a year.  The first six months were spent doing absolutely nothing in a secure room and the next six are just as bad.  very disappointed.

Everything works like it's supposed to, you work your 80 hours per 2 weeks and get your pay check on time.  Managers were very accommodating and hours were flexible.  When work was not classified they were usually OK with occasional remote work.

incredibly inclusive, well compensated, multiple employee resource groups, engagement survey results are directly encompassed in the companies efforts. the company truly sets up all employees for success

Started out working nights 12 hour days, 4 days on one week, 3 days on the next week.  I loved this shift.  After Northrop Grumman took over for ATK the schedule went to 4 ten hour days a week.  The business slowed down after about a year and a half and was moved from my original position to another department.  Immediately started looking for another company as layoffs were in the near future.
You earn paid time off and its your time so take it when you want. Everybody is willing to work with you.
An employee is just a number but if you expect more from an assembly line, you are not being genuine with yourself.  Overall its okay if that's what you want.

Northrop has provided an inviting work environment with flexible schedule, great benefits, and a supportive management team. I was provided the training and tools to do my job effectively along with the opportunity to train and grow.
excellent pay, benefits, and the best and brightest coworkers. I believe in the charter of the company and still do. the company will thrive because of the quality of employees that it attracts.
This section require a large number of words however this area is summarized with the simple phrase of outstanding. You will not find an issue with this company.
Great training & employment opportunities within one company.  No need to jump from company to company.  Multiple locations and different skillsets to learn.

If you have no job experience this is company for you. They provide you the entire world and look good on your resume with big company. Managers have no skills set except just send daily reminder to do timesheet. Corp events were silly too they provide nothing and want employees to bring foods and drinks. My project where managers were clueless and clients just bypass them. Also, corporate culture was bad too which bring morale down
Great company to work for; well versed in their field of expertise.  Would not change my experience there for anything. Great people on all levels. No complaints

Northrop Grumman, Allow you to grow and learn in field within and they care about they workers.This company allows you to travel across the globe. The most enjoyable part of the job the people you get to meet.

An amazing company, understands the military and provides a great culture. I would love to work the rest of my life at the company. They will help you with obtaining your goals and leave you in a good place for retirement.
Giant bureaucracy, both the company and the customer (DoD).  My project tried to do up to date work, most don't.  Plenty of people satisfied to fill a seat and get a paycheck.

The office is no longer the center of the universe. In today's connected world, more employees are doing work "out there" – either face-to-face with customers, in far-flung locations or simply in their pajamas.

Terrible NGC makes money hand over fist it's like they can print money . NGC took a 20 million Dollar loan from state of Maryland which they never have to pay back . Absolutely awful has been my experience my constitutional rights have been broken , but because Maryland is a work at will state there's nothing I can do against a giant like NGC it's shamefull . They have broken federal laws in my case and
Good working environment.  Good management support.  Always supply needed tools.  Challenging tasks and work.  Enjoyed research work and solving problems in project design.
Great place to work. One of the leading aerospace companies.

My supervisor worked in another state. With that being said, I worked closely with a lot of other employees. Hearing about their problems with their leadership and time off makes me sick to have been associated with this company. Sure the pay is good, but no amount of money is worth having to sacrifice time with your family.
Worst Job Ever No opportunity for College Gads to move up in the company. Unless you are chosen by upper management  not on experience and ablilities.

Good and responsible company to work for.  Size and resources allows for many/most programs and supporting technologies to be top-notch.  Love the 9/80 schedule with every other Friday off.  Very security minded for obvious reasons.  The iReturn program, originally conceived by the Society of Women engineers, is a great opportunity for older, very-experienced, talented engineers and technical/administrative folks to get a "second-shot" at resuming their career after an extended absence for a wide variety of reasons.
The people are great, multitasking is a must, challenging work and your exposed to every department at Northrop Grumman. The overall benefits are good.
Great company to work for. The company has a excellent benefits package. The pay is highly competitive. They employ quality personnel and treat employees very well.
Job did not last. After relocating there to North Dakota from Southern California, there was a lay-off after 19 months! I would have stayed but had no choice.
Northrop Grumman is leading the way with employee relations. They value their employees and seek to improve working conditions. Hours were flexible and allowed for every other Friday off.
Days start early, we work with people from the east coast across to the west coast. We have fun while working which makes the long days more enjoyable.
Moving out of state like the company, like the people I work for and with . They do need to work on benefits for there employees. Upper management is a good old boys club.

My time with Northrop Grumman Systems Corporation was a great experience! I had the chance to advance in a timely fashion. Benefits (especially their 401k program) is excellent. The job did involve a lot of travel (at least five 28-30 day business trips per year.
Very good culture. HR is very helpful. Could put more emphasis on training. Very secure work environment. Systems of records is user friendly. Recommend working there.

Northrop Grumman is a very large corporation with plenty of interesting programs to work within. I found that the 9/80 work week allowed for a very flexible work-life balance, with every other Friday off. Since it is large corporation, they make sure to compensate their employees well.
Good jobs for professional people doing exceptional work.

Great company to work for; politics and micro management culture has finally changed or disappeared. As compared to other defense contractors, Northrop Grumman remains professional and dedicated to helping their employees grow with the right tools as well as culture or projects long term.
