I very much enjoyed my days at Ricoh.  If the office did not close I would still be there.  There was no opportunity for me to move upward.  I was sorry to leave there.
Great place to work. Wonderful Supervisors, great time off. Many amenities. You are appreciated with the work you do and compensated greatly for it. Loved it.
Lack of strategic thinking.  Japanese company with lack of understanding of U.s. market .  Continual turnover with lack of empathy for customers and work force.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

You are not given enough time to accomplish the demanded tasks on a daily Basis. requiring you to work regularly on your own time to perform all your tasks. You are treated as a number a resource they milk for profit.

Had oppurtunity to apply for manager job as my site, as did two others of us. When we were told that none of us got it we celebrated. Upper management beats you to death with redundant, bullpoop tasks, endless meetings.
Great place to work. Work life balance was good. bonuses were attainable. Enjoyed working with my  team. leaned a lot from my co workers. Travel was fun and exciting.
Ricoh is a company that takes care of their employees, excellent benefits and environment.
I enjoyed my tenure at Ricoh. The type of work I performed, large project implementations, was stressful but the people and corporate culture offset it.
Management Position Need more Improvement other then that No Complaints Good company to work for and maybe retire. Will be working other Technician who great on helping each other.

I worked at Ricoh for 12 years, and it was horrible! We never got our raises when we were supposed to. Ricoh doesn't develop anyone to move up into higher positions. It was just an overall bad 12 years for me there.
Great company to work for.  Very understanding and family oriented.  Too bad the company is not making money and had to downsize, otherwise I would still work there.
comfortable place to work,good people,hours were good , no weekends, unfortunatly the location in melbourne closed all work is now done in atlanta ga. headquarters

Company focus is on making money and saving money, customer and employee satisfaction is never a real focus. Not a sustainable business strategy. Job is fairly easy, but there are too many unnecessary procedures that not only make the job annoying but make it negatively impact the customer.

The management takes the employee pay raises in lieu of bonuses for themselves. I worked there for three years and got raises of 13 cent, 22cents and the last increase never happened. THEY COULD HAVE KEPT THAT.

Employment as a Field Services Representative was a wonderful opportunity. Worked at various locations, with alot of wonderful people. Online classes help you learn about the various environments you could be placed in.
Ricoh provided numerous training opportunities for things I was interested in. Day to day work flow was not overwhelming, and the environment was fun.
No hay oportunidades de crecimiento y no consideran el trabajo de los empleados.  Los beneficios que tienen son muy buenos incluyendo el plan medico. Gracias
Sometimes I feel lost but we are in right direction changing for the better I feel happy employee make happy customer.we are training for new products which is good that makes us better tech.

When  joined, I thought that they were ready to get moving to embrace the realities of the new economy and were thinking beyond print/current but cut new ideas groups out quick.  Job never felt secure.  True copier sale mentality

Alot of problem solving and putting out fires is a typical day.  Management is not hands on, culture is no longer a team effort but individual acheivement.  Hardest part of the job is juggling all high priorities while maintaining the lower priorities.  But the best part of the job is the challenge to balance and get creative on how to solve problems.

Depending on what location you are at, some are good, some are not so good. Mostly it's laid back and completely boring. If you want a super easy lazy job, you'll find one here. Pay isn't great and raises are worse but you'll work 9-5 and do very little in most cases.

Working at RICOH was one of my worst working experiences.  I found this company to not be very unprofessional.  Simply resignation instructions were not given clearly, and at the end of my employment I'm asked for something I was never given.  The only thing RICOH cares about is the client the client the client.  I suffered abuse in so my many ways.
I work for Ricoh for 3 years it depend on what Site you work for if you were happy or not. I was not happy with the management of the last site I work for.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.
Good company with good people. The majority will help you.

Took early buyout to move on from company. I felt they just did not care about their employees, just keep machines running with mimimal use of parts to keep things running. not proactive on machine repairs and customer service

Ricoh's Mailroom support service is primarily interested in generating endless reports to prove their value to the customer. They will drive you nuts with countless meetings and endless requests for more, and more data to generate more, and more reports.

Ricoh provides the training and tools needed to succeed.  Career advancement was always available.  Compensation/commission structure could use some improvement.  Overall, Ricoh has an amazing culture, however like many companies, they are always looking for areas to cut cost.  Unfortunately, Ricoh often times chooses to cut people in order to cut those costs, and not just people, but people that have the knowledge and experience. Ricoh's tagline of "Imagine Change" is very fitting.  Operations and processes are in a constant state of change, which can prove very challenging to the sales force.  Often times, these changes are implemented without the proper preparations completed first to ensure they are successful. Overall, my experience at Ricoh was a positive one.

Manager sits her office all day with her back facing towards the door. There's no training, you are literally thrown in the job with no training, then the manager tells you she didn't receive something in her in box because you didn't know how to do the paperwork, then she makes you feel like an idiot in front of other employees, which could care less about their jobs. No responsibility, documents come up missing all the time, including checks. Have to walk around on egg shells afraid to say anything to the other employees because there's favoritism, so you have to watch what you say. I witnessed many times where one employee would go out of his way to get information then twists it and brings it back to the manager.  She sits in her office all day so she needs a spy.  I take on too much responsibility because that's who I am, I care, I don't know how not too, most days I don't get a break but you can bet the others will get theirs, even when its 20 minutes before they clock out to go home.  Horrible working environment if you're a hard, responsible, caring employee like me. Look elsewhere.

During 25 years and multiple mergers and acquisitions it was inconsistent. Sometimes very enjoyable and sometimes very unrewarding, depending upon management at the time. Although adaptability is a requirement in an ever changing business environment, during the last 10 years the changes seemed to made just for the sake of change without any clear path.

I had a great opportunity with this company to get introduced to corporate America.  senior management ties to keep up the company's culture. The best part of the job is to interact with so many people, customers and coworkers.
Lennar corporation was an amazing, educational experience. I loved working their. everyone was friendly and management was so hands on. The corporation and everything they offered was great

Ricoh Co., Ltd. engages in the development, production, sale, and provision of services for imaging, network system solutions, and industrial products. It operates through the following segments: Imaging & Solutions, Industrial Products, and Other. The Imaging & Solutions segment consists of products that are used in the office and production printing environments.  The Industrial Products segment manufactures and sells thermal media, optical equipment, semiconductor devices, and electronic components. The Other segment includes digital cameras, financing, and logistics services.
Love the job and people I work with, but the pay is hard to live on. I love the work, and constantly being busy, and the hours as well as being Monday through Friday...
No hay uniformidad para todos por igual para unos sí para otros no si eres de los oritegidos
Ricoh is a great place to work just have to deal with some unprofessional co-workers at times. It's pretty much laid back company not to strict on dress code.
The pay at ricoh is very low. I started as a temp and made more money as a temp then i do as a employee for the company. If u have a lot of bills this is not the job for you!!
Offering the most modern technology is a benefit. Management is excellent.
Good place to work if you like B2B sales, Things went south in 2009 commissions went way down and sales slowed down. I don't know if things have gotten better since I left.
I would absolutely consider working for Ricoh again in the future. I had a positive work experience despite not having the tenure to be retained through a corporate change of contract.

Ricoh has a world of nice and hardworking co-workers.  Dealing with my teammates was the best part of the job. My jobs with Ricoh would vary depending on the marketing programs that Ricoh would institute on a regular basis.  Sometimes these were radical changes and required a new effort to get back to where we were before the changes.  Being a large organization adoption of new technologies was slower than I would prefer.
contact business for payment on maintenance agreement and make payment arrangement as needed.  Conference calls and review of ar with manager on staff
I cannot review this company in good faith. Some of the executives remain. Many over 20 years at company.
Actually loved the work but the KPI’s are absolutely ridiculous, no advancement opportunities, Micro Management is absolutely horrible, you are a resource not a person

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

The managers are great and understanding, the culture is very collaborative, and the pay-to-amount of work ratio is good. I do wish that Ricoh paid just a little bit more but all in all it was a great company

The very first day I was hired by this company the actual hiring manager told me about the assistant manager and one of the employees sleeping together. She constantly had drama stirring up between employees and kept people scared to stand up for themselves. She hired nothing but her older friends who picked on the younger employees and expressed jealousy. The benefits weren't that great in fact I ended up having an extra bill after one hospital trip and I've been working there for a 1 1/2. The higher ups were uncaring and although they knew who the issue was they refused to fix it. Instead they gave her a raise and a promotion. anybody from the age of 18-25 this place isn't for you this woman went through 5 young employees within the last couple of years and shes only been rewarded with a promotion. She has these deep " caring" convos in the supply closet where she pretends she cares tries to manipulate you into gossiping or becoming her squealer then once neither happens she works on your exit day by day. rumor by rumor. the convos are supposed to be professional and private SHE TELLS THE WHOLE OFFICE OF BUDDY HIRES. Not to mention the law firm (which were our clients) was in full out war with us. One employee continued to talk about my skinny weight and coarse hair. Instead of my manager having my back she sided with the woman just because she hated me. However she always fought for her buddy hires. This place is a joke. Lastly, my checks decreased monthly and we had one raise which was divided among the employees I never saw a penny. Don't believe me apply.
A typical day at work is ok. The employees are nice, but do not tell your business because the entire office will know by the next day.
I love the family environment we had Ricoh. Even when it was tense in a day we found some way to get through it and work together to get the daily job done.

Everybody at Ricoh make you feel welcome since day one. Managers were always helpful when you needed them but were never looking over your shoulders making you feel uncomfortable while doing your task.
This was a well
Company is poorly ran employees and managment are underhanded and snakes will back stab people to get to top seen it done to a couple of people dont do it
Ricoh was a starter job.

Too many employees hired without accommodations for them lead to hostility and daily competition. Also unorganized and poor communication between manager and work group. Employees treated as interchangeable pieces and not individual people.
There's not much room for a pay raise. Getting time off for vacation was nearly impossible due to "no coverage" and even trying to get time off for doctors appointments etc. was a hassle.

Ricoh is changing to adapt to market and manufacturing conditions within a very competitive environment.  Ricoh is doing a great job of adopting new solution sets and helping organizations to reinvent.
Very poor management work-life balance benefits discrimination of your treatment favoritism no job advancement placement a relocation assistance none of that was ever offered

So much too say but rather not. I know they are not a trustworthy company . The company is about who you know. They don't take care of their employees. After fifteen years of my life given I was very heartbroken with this company decisions they will laid off and constantly time you that you're job is secure.
Its was pleasure  to work with big family like Ricoh in Kosovo, we learn to ma manage a time for deadlines, how to compare with clients. I would like to big thanks for Ricoh overworld.
The job itself no hard in terms of understand. Management is horrible. They dont care about those that work for them if thy have an opinion or  a voic. You have to shut up look down and work
Mannegers needs to listhing. More to the team leader . let us gave ideas to work better be more apecific with the dress code .gave us better reviews .more comunication
Printing is downsizing and moving to on site services. The profitability in this industry is continuing to decline in hardware sales. Therefore requiring the organization to restructure frequently

Ricoh offers many different roles for any potential candidate skill set. You can start in entry level sales or if interested in more Technical opportunities, options are available. If you like working in a team environment to accomplish one common goal then I’d suggest applying and have recruiter try to match previous skill sets for open job opportunities

Waste of time, frankly. Subpar pay for position duties - essentially a bait and switch - and a preschool-like, inflexible work environment, straight out of the 1960s. Not for seasoned professionals or technically adept folks who expect a degree of work-life balance flexibility.
Good, I enjoyed my time there as a machine operator and I enjoyed the flexible schedule I was given. I liked the work enlivenment in the place with my fellow coworkers.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

I worked at Ricoh as a temp. I started out working 1st shift and then ended up working 2nd shift. My job title was warehouse associate. The job wasn't hard but the employee's and management made it hard. And they take forever before they hire temps on.
Worked at different locations. Traveling required.  Need car for travel. Some locations are not metro accessible. You get an Hour for lunch each day..
Ricoh was my first ever job I got the job right when I graduated high school and it matured me a lot for that I will always appreciate it it basically showed me how to be responsible
Team oriented

Bad supervisor. Had one person that there manager role over the entire department with her negative, controlling ways. He allowed it. He lost 3 good workers for lack of managing her and the department in general
People matter most, higher pay should be offered. Productive spaces and great teams depending on what account you are with. Overall very good experience. Management team is very knowledgeable.

Culture varies by location/region. Not a slave driver but, expect results. Good work/life balance, although a bit dated in work requirements (i.e. managing remotely). Pay is good depending on location or reporting structure.
First we would come in and clock in an get ourselves prepared for the work day and then we pick out sheet to calculate our number for the day and anything else that is required.
I loved my time at Ricoh. They have a strong culture of hiring from within and providing a variety of training and development tools for all levels of employee.

I worked for Ricoh 2 years and was promoted twice. I worked very well until  I started a new position at a site with a manager who bullied her employees and favored others who kept quiet. I became pregnant and during this time the harassment from my manager became constant. I reported it but HR investigation determined there was no harassment.
The sky is the limit, it depends on you to advance and grow through their online training.  There are many positions to advance to and most of what you need to advance is online in Ricoh E-learning

Ricoh is going through an outsourcing process.  Jobs are being sent overseas.  I have been offered a Voluntary Separation Incentive Program due to the number of years I have been with the company.  They are very informative and caring company to work for.

This company through major mistakes in business decisions was forced to lay off many people. The culture is absolutely unethical, they ask you to do anything in order to make a number, because all the management is under pressure, since the company is in terrible financial standing. I am waiting to a right opportunity to leave this terrible work place, and will not recommend it to anyone. I foresee a terrible future in store for the company, and they continue to lay off personnel.
This industry is not for the faint of heart.  Hard work and determination are the keys to success.  If you can cut it here you can cut it anywhere! Good luck!
Good colleagues, good culture, good benefits,gratifying work, sometimes long hours, Good Management support. Opportunities for some training. .Not to much travel

The work was stressful but not overly so.  Mainly my issue was with management.  Our outfit was never supported the way it needed to be so we were constantly under the gun and seemed to be the whipping boy.  Any customer complaints, even they were unfounded or unavoidable, were brought down on me supervisor's head.  He left quickly after I was hired and his replacement was too passive to fight for himself.  It led to a miserable boss which trickled down to our team.  It got to the point where we went from 7 employees to 2 and never had a replacement hired, just a shifted workload and higher expectations.

The office products industry is in transition, which affects the current strategic direction that the company is taking. This constant change of direction has created a very stressful workplace environment which resulted in making it very difficult to get things done on a regular basis.
The work culture is pretty fair, more independence if you get into the right job/career. Everyone worked well with each other to support the various needs.
No job stability. A huge part of my department was laid off. Otherwise, while there it was good for work-life balance. Worked from home most of the time.

I would walk in in the mornings greet everyone,open up my computer look at everything that needed to be done for the day. I would then start ordering supplies, along with doing inventory on supplies we currently had on hand. after all that was done i would help my team with whatever they needed help with so we could finish everything in a timely matter.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

VERY poor management skills, you are just a number, management does not stand behind their employees.  They were always trying to play "got ya".  Started at $17/per hour and 5 years later was at $17.56.  Was never put on a path for success.  This place will set you up for failure and had a "good ole boys club".  You will have to meet 76 different numbers on a metrics in order to get what little raise they will give.
My current position is very satisfying, I have had 3 great bosses at Ricoh.
Great company to work for it was a pleasure working there.
benefits and 401k are pretty good. paid vacation and sick time is good too. starting wages could be much better. their 6% contribution to your retirement fund is great.
My job was eliminated after just over a year working here. They closed the office in my town. When the CEO from Japan came in he got rid of over 1,000 people in my position.
Ricoh is a great company to work for.  They are professional and are fair and very supportive of their staff.  You work directly with the staff of the contract and everyone is very helpful.
Ricoh doesn’t care about their employees and they make it known. They don’t care about anything but themselves. Fine for a started job but other than that it’s awful.

Interviewing at Ricoh almost made me not want to except the job offer when it came.  It was a panel interview and one of the managers was almost hostile in his way of questioning.  Fast forward a couple of years, and two of the managers on the panel are no longer with the company one (the abrasive Manager) was eventually terminated and another was forced into early retirement.  The layout of the office looks like the new world of work, but the mindset is clearly not. Many of the Managers management styles and way of thinking is still very antiquated and punitive. There are opportunities for advancement depending on your connections and getting a promotion does not secure your place in the company, as the company is currently forcing early retirement on employees, laying off those that don’t “opt in” and outsourcing, then closing departments; subsequently laying off those employees as well. I say keep searching if you’re looking for a ‘career.’ If you’re looking to learning and then move on, a ‘stop’ at Ricoh may benefit you. But enter at your own risk they’re clearly in financial trouble.

Not a customer or employee focused company at all. The toxic culture of IKON has infected the company. Not a good choice for a long term career. Excellent equipment, but a toxic, anti customer corporate culture.

Ricoh is a very nice company to work for, management doesn’t breathe down your neck every second and you are largely left alone. There is a lot of accountability as my boss lives in a different town and I maybe see my boss once a month if that. As an FSR you will probably be on the road a lot traveling to different sites. You are responsible for being at the right site at the right time. Most sites I visit are pretty slow. So there is a lot of downtime.
Ricoh is a company downsizing and eliminating entire departments by outsourcing the jobs to a foreign country. Senior Management does it's best to side with the company you are being outsourced to.

My day would consist of floating around from department to department and reliving my co-workers from their duty so they could get help. The two department I worked in were reception and logistics. Which gave a ton of office experience.
Okay place to work . No work life balance. Work is stressful. Management seems out of touch with workers. Poor compensation. A lot of work for little pay
The job is fine. Not much of an opportunity to grow within the company so it's perfect if you're cool with that. You don't make a lot but you don't really do much so it balances itself out.

When i first started to work there it was great but after being there for a year i learned with this company. They do not give good raises per year,doing more than just your job, not get paid enough for the amount of work they give you, no bonuses, they are very weird when it comes to paying you for mileage if you had to drive to another site, don't show appreciation to their staff as much as they should unless your higher up and overall they do not pay you as much as your worth working there.

Ricoh is a special company that really emphasizes on helping their employees grow professionally. They have a learning platform that helps you become more professional. Need help giving better customer support, Ricoh can help. Need help becoming a leader or even in management, Ricoh's got you covered. Even in technical aspects, Ricoh helps their employees not only learn new things, but excel in them.
not a place for someone looking to be in IT. this is more customer service. no growth for IT positions. been with the company for years and haven't done anything useful.
Worked with some great people, pay was good, as well as benefits.  Work hours were long especially during month end close process.  The company offered flex work schedules and casual dress code.

The title says it all. 3 years without a raise. Shuffled from one position to another with a complete lack of training. Held accountable for the mistakes of others. Physically threatened and verbally abused. A culture of blame and fear. Don't do it. For the love of God just don't.

I have a good relationship with upper management.  I enjoy working with the many different people I encounter each day at the job sites.  The hardest part is traveling all day to different job sites.  The culture is very comfortable.  I can contact my manager at any time and feel that he will respond to my questions and needs.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.
Ricoh has it's Pros and Cons great people . Would like more pay however Ricoh is an okay Job to have . Some of their Jobs have growing room . Overall decent place to work .
raises are SO hard to get. If you choose to work here make sure you are being compensated correctly. Thats the only advice i can really give. Also free lunch
Strong work environment. Many daily opportunities to gain further experience. Career advancement opportunities. Co-workers that genuinely care about you.

Management & anyone training in the Arkansas chapter are lunatics to put it nicely. I couldn't believe the chaotic disaster that I hired into! Management via B.H. was more closely related to constant terrorizing of the employees. Extreme gaslighting & narcissistic behavior & patterns of constant attempts at manipulating employees under him. Awful company to work for & the equipment we were assigned was terribly faulty. I wouldn't recommend this company to ANYONE!

I worked here for ten years. I processed mail for TD Ameritrade. I endured the process of the TD Waterhouse/Ameritrade merger. They brought in a TD Waterhouse employee to train us to take his job. Needless to say, we were not trained well. We did survive and thrived once we got it all figured out. In the ten years I worked there, I went three years without a raise. Twice because of the economy and once because a tsunami struck in Japan and hit Ricoh's headquarters. At least, that's what they TOLD us. If you're in a pinch and don't mind getting to work in the wee hours of the morning, it's an okay job. The work keeps you busy. You'll have to work some Saturdays as well, but you do get a day off in the middle of the week.

Raises are on par with fast food joints and Big box stores. You'll get your raise about 6 months after your review. Upper management are basically leaches on the hard working blue collar employees. If there's an incentive for lower employees, upper management cashes in too even though they had nothing to do with the actual work put in to gain the incentive. Upper management can be very pompous, cold and uptight. It's a job. You are paid at poverty level and when review time comes around they tell you how poorly the company did last quarter, so you'll accept the bottom of the barrel .15 cent raise. It takes an act of Congress for them to follow through with anything. They don't like to fire people. So, you will be expected take up the slack for lazy unethical employees, even if they make more than you. Just look for another company to work for.
Not a great place for advancement... unless you’re already at an advanced level.been in the same position for years — no upward mobility in pay or degree of difficulty. Underemployed.

Most of the successful people that I met there were rather a**l retentive, afraid to express themselves. Although upper management touts being innovative, being innovative is discouraged by the majority of managers (mostly "yes" people).  That sense of someone watching over your shoulder, or feeling of paranoia may not be imagined.  It's all about the numbers, despite the denials.  Good luck.
Ricoh is a place with constant changes. Ricoh gives you a lot of training and tuition reimbursement which will help if you want to pursue your education. Good place to work

Theu didnt care about their employees. worked 7 days a week and never wanted to pay the hardworking ones. They took advantage of the good employees. mangers were so disrespectful  and rude when you talked to them
For most part working for Ricoh can be great but some of the sites are not friendly at all and that’s when you want to leave the site of asked not to send me their.
I enjoyed working with Ricoh, yes it had its challenging moments. I embraced each position in a very positive mind and worked to complete my task in a timely manner
If you work At a  site that is upbeat the job is all the more worth it . If your site is quite and not that busy your job could be really slow and feel like your days go on forever.

Management is terrible and people are not held accountable for corporate policies and procedures. Human resources in this company is a joke. You will never have opportunites for advancement and they will replace you in a week. They also do not tolerate people of different backgrounds or disabilities.

There is no way I would work at this location until there is a change in the Market Place VP / Managing Director. You will spend all day going through CYA Drills per his direction, instead of focusing on the required tasks. The only good thing I can say is if it wasn't for the Area's Operations Leadership, this Unit would have been desimated.
Good company but looking for better pay. Part of a great team. Interacted daily with managers and teammates. Travel was a little far though.  I'm looking for a better paying job and better location.
I will never work for Ricoh again, unless I want to be put in my grave from abuse and harassment.   The more you  talk to higher management about the problem the more they treat you like dirt.

I would not recommend anyone there . The manager don't care about his employees just himself and always criticizing us knowing that none us been there for a year. We do all the work with not enough training for him to come and blame everything on us is so wrong.
The best part of Ricoh is the people you get to work with.  They exist all over the United States of America and are available by telephone and internet by previous scheduled appointment.
It is a great global company and perfect job procedure, but hard to improve when special situation.  Good pay in salary, bonus, & 401K match, also job security.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.
Be prepared to be put in a position w/little training and a client who is demanding of your time and patience.  If you are not patient and the client knows your weakness, you will walk out.

Be careful and research this business from top-to-bottom before going all in. It felt like we were always struggling to make an impact - due in part to how hard it was get leadership to listen to ideas.
Ricoh always encourages a positive work environment where people feel valued and appreciated every day; with good plans and policies, that are very easy to understand.
plenty of work. had fun working with the schools. Our over all manger was always trying to help co-workers get along. he was always very involved. Love the machines.
All i can write is those two guys need to go to management classes. They need undercover to know what these two guys are doing. 3 of us worked very hard but need to have 4 workers.
Ricoh is a good company to work for. However my manager at the time was to busy with other accounts and people that I felt like I was not able to develop and grow.

This a contracting side of Ricoh. They call it" managed services". They contract you out to a list of companies to do Reception and mail room duties. I work for a big manufacturing company doing reception. The company i work for ignores you unless they need something. The executive staff is horribly rude. I was lied to about the amount of work and how busy it is supposed to be. They just hire to fill in warm bodies. I would NOT recommend them to anyone to work for.
This company was the first that I worked for when I arrived in GA.  It is a good company to work for. And the staff in amazing.  I am glad I got this experience.

Was a learning experience and happy with the job but needed to move back to Charlotte to help with a sick family member. There was alot of training that helped with the position and good communication with management.

Job was easy loved working there but got let go because apparently we aren't allowed to have two jobs which I have never heard of in my entire life management doesn't speak but if they did it wasn't a polite time always sound so rude and workers were really awesome there that's for sure some were playing favoritism which isn't common it's like that everywhere and also you wouldn't be permanent til after a year

I can say that management is totally out of touch and has no idea how to move forward.  Don’t know how this company will grow profits when technology advances so quickly and ricoh is stuck using dead technology and has 0 innovation.
Ricoh's goal is to advance digitalization in the workplace, harnessing the power of data and making information work for customers through process optimization and automation.

Career advancement is dependent upon who your manager is.  They want to keep you down so that you won't leave. Co-Workers were great though. You must find fulfillment through working with the client on projects but then remember that you're not actually apart of the team.
Diagnosing and repairing copiers and printers. Upgrading firmware and java. Teamwork. If I can't figure something out the other Techs offer there experience.
Note,

Ricoh has a well maintained business relationship with a lot of well known companies. The hardest part of the job is to stay current with all that Ricoh has to offer and to stay current with what the client has to offer. Our goal is to keep the happy client and to fulfill their needs.
I enjoyed working for ricohs . Its fast pace no stress peaceful environment. Noce temp. Hard working people . You are in control of your numbers that u get done

Ricoh is in constant change of strategy and management.  High turnover, low pay.  My manager was demoted one year into my job there.  VP of Sales for the Orlando Marketplace was laid-off after 30 years with the company.
Express(Ricoh job site) was a fun and productive workplace with friendly people.I also liked to play on the ping pong table.I really enjoyed my time there.

I have been working here for a year now and I love it. The work life balance is great and management is very understanding when something comes up. The benefits are readily available when you begin and the people are amazing to work with

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

Fast pace environment and culture, but at same time, focus on team.  While my job function was up in the air because management had no idea about incoming work load, I still had a good experience working there.
I would still be working there if the company didn't downsize. The most enjoyable part of the job is working with a great group of people. Management was great and training was always available.

To much bullying by coworkers and lead floor mental abuse in every department 30 min lunch breaks and 1 10 min. Break more like 7-8 because they time you from the time they take over ur machine then if you are a min. Late you get fussed out

Company is closing and laying off Departments one by one. Moved corporate to Atlanta and many people lost there jobs.  They should have given people the truth before they new they would be losing job.
My site manager was pretty great. The company itself is okay but just depends on how your site is. Heard the other sites are pretty relaxed as well unless you're in sales.
Great company to work for. The salary is competitive, benefit are great, and lots of vacation time. Rarely have over time. Work Monday through Friday, first, and second shift.
Great place to work, but very slow job, Had nothing to do but sit there and hope for the manager to find some type of work. However they onsite manager was very nice.

Extremely corporate atmosphere. Company likes to make you think you're part of a family, but unless you choose to advance up the ladder, you're just another cog in the machine. Hard work and diligence to your job position is not shown on your paycheck. Raises were never significant, and sometimes were never given. No cost of living increases. Mandatory training that had zero relation to your current job position was often required, and was a distraction from your daily responsibilities. Managers were often just pencil pushers that stayed in the back office all day and chose to ignore issues and concerns on the floor. Upper management was usually clueless to how the site was really running, and the workers who invested their time and energy exhaustively were hardly recognized for their efforts.

Terrible upper management, always speak of progression in the company but don't produce results to match what they say. Refuse to give decent raises and is constantly on a "freeze" for merit raises. Company seems to be in a downward spiral. Wouldn't recommend working for Ricoh.

Ricoh is more about the Company. They have training online. You do have flexibility of moving to different location throughout the country. The only way to make a suitable income is to be in an upper management position. You can grow into those areas by doing the training and working toward your goals. They have great benefits as well as vacation and floating holidays as well as regular holiday pay.
Every changing fast paced environment which also respected an employees work-life balance. Offers competitive benefit plan and has flex work space and remote office options based on the position.
Poor management.  Your expected to do a lot for others that dont even pertain  to your position. Also OT is given but yet they dont want 2 pay. Shows favoritism  & all where very two faced back atabb
Ricoh needs to upgrade their equipment. they also have a high turnover rate. Supply dept is the lowest paying position and the most stressful, due to micromanaging.
A typical day sometimes could be stressful and sometimes more duties was added without enough notice. Some management was not very friendly or professional. Some days was very stressful
Great place to work, everyone is friendly and nice.  Great training program and company really cares about there employees. They listen to what you have to say.

Company was great when I first  started they tried to grow too much in services and could not support remote locations. They were better positioned for larger cities for support. Techs are awesome very knowledgeable.
Management could be a lot better as well as incentives annually.

Do not trust this company. They do not care about long time employees. They will use you and then toss you aside! There is FAR TOO MUCH executive management, outsourcing to foreign countries for cheap labor, and politics. Run...don't walk!

Treat you like a servant down and dirty work add to your job description constantly and given no choice to reject the added job ie cleaning the office gym that was the straw that broke the camel's back for me.  Unfairness with coworkers you had lazy ones riding on the coattails of the hardworking ones there was no reward for being exceptional.  Started off full of positivity left a shell of a person beaten down by negativity

Lot of things to accomplish daily to maintain company guidelines and make sales goals. Laptops used for job were old and dated. You had to clear history  continually and laptop batteries would not hold charge .

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

As copiers are declining so is this company!  Ricoh is not friendly to people with disabilities.  Ricoh doesn't have a good HR process, people there are good, but upper HR is by phone.  RICOH Japan believes the copier biz is good in the states as the VP's that are there would buy smaller dot Coms and leverage their gains against Ricoh's losses.   RICOH Dosent trust its employees.   Don't expect any level of management to tell the truth.
Management sucks.  Too much “good cop/bad cop.” Way too much favoritism! People were cool. They under bid contracts so the don’t pay the employees for the true value of their work they perform.

This place is the most horrible place to work, if you like being micromanaged then this is the place for you. Management finds something to pick on you about all the time and it’s over the smallest things. Unless you are perfect or gossiper do not even apply here. You literally get made to feel like you are worthless and have to worry every week what you will be scolded over and or
Seems to be constant changes.  No clear direction for the company at this time.  Morale is very low right now due to all of the changes and a lack of direction.
I enjoy being kept busy.  Management is not very supportive of it's employees.  The hardest part of my job is dealing with other co-workers that seem to always want to start trouble with others.
Good co-workers, management lacks of empowerment from regional management, dedicated to a dying market, great sales team and profit oriented. Work hard and play hard.
I have been employed with Ricoh for a while. It's an ok job however, they definitely need to pay more money. As well as provide better benefits for the team members.
Challenging at times but excellant work schedule. Good benefits.  Break times not always possible due to user interface.  Daily functions can vary based on the needs of the customer.

Ricoh provided a great blank canvas for personal development and the support received from mentors and co-workers translates into an ability to pay it forward when others need a leg up.  The company, like many others, is in transition from old style manufacturing and logistics to a services-led model that seeks to break out of the pack and lead in new directions in new emerging markets. Chaotic at times sure, but disruption is the new normal and suits the nimble.

You don't really learn any applicable life skills outside of a copy center/mailroom functions. It's something that I took to try something new. Coworker can be dull, and the places you work at don't seem to care about your existence either.

I enjoyed the work and the training they offered. My only complaint is they pay less than a livable wage and you tend to work for highly trained professionals which can lead to strained relationships with the client. Not for everyone or the clinically depressed lol
Am very happy to worked Multi National Company and this  my second MNC company. Well organised company. First year weeks paid leave and sick leaves also.

Fun new experience with a very diverse company. So many opportunities to grow and really develop your skills. One of the most amazing things about this company is there willingness to help pay your tuition.
Ricoh has fallen on hard times and it shows in the culture and the moral of employees.  What was once a great place to work is no longer.  No one feels secure at least in my area

If you want to be promoted, better start kissing the back-side of your management team, otherwise you will go nowhere. This company only cares about the bottom line, not its employees. Their raises are beyond pathetic. They says 3% if you do well on your reviews. Not true. I received all high marks, and still got 1% raise. Management did all they could to undermine you. They gave you some independence, so they say, but immediately turned on you if they do not approve, and made you look bad in front of the client.

Ricoh  for the most part has been a good company to work for.  They are a competitive company and provide opportunities for growth within the company. There are some issues with management as it is with many companies.
Has potential but not a lot of room for advancement. Management has a lot of room to grow and communication could be better. Vacation and benefits are a good thing!
Great company to work for.

The company seems legit. However, there are people who are very unprofessional at work, and they seem like they would allow it. I was let go of a personal matter. I am a Vet, and I have disabilities. However, they did what they wanted anyway. I can not believe they treated me like this. I will never work for companies like this.
This is a fast paced working environment where you interact with attorneys, secretaries, & paralegals of both firms-Balch & Bingham and Burr & Foreman, LLP.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

Ricoh is a great company start with if you are looking for full-time employment, with benefits, and healthcare. When I first started at Ricoh, I was an office assistant. If you are hired as an office assistant, you are placed at a client site. The client, you are under their contract and follow the client’s holiday schedule and rules for being in the client’s office. You are paid for site holidays, holidays, vacations, power outages, inclement weather. Also, you do everything that is required of you in that contract. With Ricoh you are able to stay full time even if that contract is up. Ricoh has other client locations if you want to relocate or even become an FSR. If you’ve been their for sometime they may extend that offer to you. Then you can become a field service representative and work at multiple locations. You can work at IT companies, marketing companies, law firms, consumer product companies, and more. Depending on the location you may be printing documents for lawyers, sorting mail, designing logos, headquarters receptionist, printing, creating gbc books, spiral, posters. As an FSR, you will be paid mileage in addition to your hourly salary. The salary of an FSR is better than an office assistant because of mileage. You cover at locations and have many coworkers you see. If you’re far from a location you can tell your manager not to send you there. Instead cover at client sites 10min - 1 hour away from you. With my hourly pay and mileage I am happy. However, I feel I can do much better. As I studied art and design and it being a printing company unfortunately, it

I loved the autonomy of working at different locations everyday, meeting new people and rarely being stuck behind a desk. Management gave me the trust I needed to do a good job without looking over my shoulder constantly.
Is a very good place to work every one is ready to help, every one is responsible, Safety Conscious, Dependable, reliable and caring people, good atmosphere

A work day consists of getting orders audited, entered and booked. Answering emails, sending emails for revisions and handling customer disputes and needs. Management for the most part was always hands on and available when needed. The workplace environment was always busy and stressful at times but the moral within the business was always great to keep going. There was not really a hard part other than keeping up with all that was needed to stay ahead of things. I enjoyed mostly the moral and company surrounding which made my job enjoyable.
it's ok to work here .im just tying too move on.
Ricoh was not just my second home but also the place where I learn so many things.
Clean and quiet atmosphere. Very customer-oriented.  Great training programs and decent benefits. Game room, quiet room and frequent employee morale events.

I worked here for just over 1 year and it wasnt too bad. The main issue I had was with management. The contracted manager would tell us to do one thing, and the Ricoh manager would tell us to do the complete opposite. In fact, within Ricoh itself I felt there were too many levels of management and the communication wasnt very good. There were decent benefits tho, free gym and on occasion free lunches as a reward for our good work.  I did feel valued as an employee (was told my work was good) I just felt like because I was contracted I had no job security which was true. Also the pay was quite low for a position which required a bachelor's degree. I was making the same with a high school diploma. However, the staff were all nice and professional.

As an FSR, I have been to different location from the most boring location to the busiest location. Very little motivation or incentives. The company seems to be more toward saving most at the cost of quality employees.

I lived the segmented teams. I worked health related accounts. Management cares about developing employees. The leadership team has 4 awesome folks! Lots of contests that they get involved in. Such as wearing silly costumes themed to the contest.

Overall, it really depends on the site you are applying to work for. It can be amazing, or a train wreck. Many of my friends are FSRs (work at numerous sites as needed for coverage) and nothing is consistent from site-to-site. The site I worked at was well run, with great corporate clients who appreciated the work we did. My direct supervisor as well as my IAM (essentially a district manager) were amazing people to work with.
So many opportunities to move up or even from city to city. Times are always changing and Ricoh is embracing the change by changing along with the times.
Competition like feel in a hostile workplace where management forces sales rather than encourages. No sense of help or responsibility from management.

The company itself is very great but it is truly the management oh, the management team is usually made up of guys who have never worked the entry level positions. At times things can get really slow and managers who have no work for you become upset with employees. Pay is low in comparison to what you do ,you can go from hardware based assignments , networking Amazon technologies,etc. You basically utilize all skills here that those fancy cert test say you need. The workforce at Ricoh is talented but compensated low. Overall the managers make it unbearable at times.
Misleading leadership. Unfair wages. Ask too much for too little.

I am still employed with Ricoh and I’ll be so happy when I’m not.  The managers micro-manage you to death.  The pay is measly, but it’s nice to earn PTO after less than 30 days of employment.  Managers spy on you but can’t even give a “good morning” most days

The starting pay is low and below poverty for a print and mail clerk but advancement can pay well from what I hear.  Great benefits somewhat affordable.  They put me into an acting manager role without asking me or telling me and then had me figure out monthly reports on my own with lack of training or resources.

Can be a great place to work under the right manager. I learned a great deal at this company and increased in knowledge a great deal. Under some of the better personnel, I was able to flourish in my roles. But as things change then often times so does the comfort ability of the place. All in all, I enjoyed my time and found some great life long friends in the process.
Ricoh is good company.
Executive management changes direction much to often.  Many layoffs over the past two years.  Focus changed a lot.  I am not sure what else to say about this company.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.
Ricoh is a good technology firm to work for.
Good place to work. Took care of it's people and family balance. Good manager and mentors. Supervisors worked with each other. Had great benefits and great workers.
Place was ok to work in, initially bland but in recent years there have been efforts to liven up the place a bit. Lots of inovation in the building in recent years.
Ricoh is a great company to work for, but tend to be unfair when it comes to wages. I love my job but dislike the pay enough to go out job hunting. :/
Ricoh was a great experience for me. I was promoted to manager in after a year of employment. If i wanted to change the department that I work for, trainning was provided.

I like building relationships with my customers, and really getting to know every aspect of their business---from their mission statement, work culture, and strategizing what I can do to help their business grow with the goods and services that I have to offer.
Low pay a awful management played favorites  with certain  employees.

I worked for several divisions of Ricoh over the course of 35 years.  Ricoh, as most large global companies, had ups and downs, and always change driven.  Overall the company was a good company, but much depended on what specific division or assignment you might be in at any given time.  Flux in management kept targets moving, and policies, focus, and pay structure were continuously changing....sapping energy from the workforce that could have been directed towards securing business.
I loved working at Ricoh benefits where good pay was okay but got laid off after 15 years. I missed 3 lay offs working for Ricoh. They appreciated hard work.
The work is not mysterious and it is steady - but also not glamorous .
It was an ever changing position. Was laid off after almost   years with company. They closed call center & moved all jobs to GA & I was not willing to relocate
It's ok for a call center but the business is changing too slowly for a dying industry. Advancement is possible depending on who you know, not what you know.
I have worked at Ricoh for over a decade. Great sense of stability but  sometimes upper management focuses on things that seem to divide the team as a whole.

I have enjoyed working at this company but upper management has done a poor job running the business.  The last few years they've had a significant amount of layoffs.  There was a time this was a fun competitive place to work.  If things don't change soon most of their business will be managed through dealer channels.

For those who like this industry, it may be a good fit for you.  I found that the culture was not modern and the leadership was not able to manage high performance employees who were innovative in their thinking.

I loved working here, I would have never left if they didn't hire this new girl that had everything negative and bad to say about everything. Other than that really no advancements, but you are automatically permanent here so this place has great job security. You are only working with 4 or 5 other people and that's it. Great and easy job.
I would never work for ricoh usa again they will fire you at a drop of a dime. You'll never know what to expect for management one day your here and the next day your gone.

Company doesn't offer adequate support/ or accommodations for expecting mothers. I practically begged for help at my site and was not offer any (even though I submitted all the paperwork they asked for) until AFTER I got injured at work WHILE PREGNANT. They should also improve their maternity leave benefits. Don't get pregnant while working for this company. There is also very little room for growth here.

Felt valued as a sales professional.  Given opportunities for career advancement and training.  Work culture, support and co-workers were fantastic.  Definitely a changing industry that is trying to get more into the tech space.  Not sure what the future holds.

Ricoh is a place where you work on site as a vendor offering contracted services to your customer. Like any job there is opportunity there is room for advancement, but if you find a boss who will not stand up for there employees you will have problems. I had three raises in my time and was thrown into a situation with no training only to uncover poor ethical choices made by my superior.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.
Ricoh Americas Corporation is a great place to work.  I would recommend working at Ricoh to anyone who asks. Work life balance is not a problem and Ricoh gives you every chance to succeed.

FSR's are required to do a lot of travel working within the city. This position is great if you want to gain some exposure and experience within some of the largest companies around. We have contracts with Nike, Adidas, and Amazon to name a few. It's nice to see a glimpse of how these companies operate. Your work will not always go appreciated, but the experience itself feels rewarding.
Local management was okay but Regional (Phoenix office) was terrible.  The lowest pay in the industry and it really shows.  I do recommend Canon Solution Americas,
Great atmosphere, at least on the team I was on. I had two managers both were outstanding. Wasn't very stressful outside of the commute. Spend all day on the road in the field.

I loved working at Ricoh. What I didn't love is that every year for the four years I worked there, there were MAJOR restructures that affected A LOT of people. Upper management changed every year and it would take them about six months to restructure the marketing communications teams. My entire department (1,000 people +) was let go this year. I actually made it through every other restructure but this last one. So if you want to work somewhere where you can basically count on being let go, this is the place for you. It's just a matter of when. The company has been unable to rebrand itself to being a services and solutions company and so it is constantly loosing money, which makes it a dicey working situation.
It is an interesting company, great place to learn but upper management have poor judgment and play as politician. Great workplace culture and friendly environment.
It's never the same.  Everyday there is something different.  Making posters, flyers, business cards or just exams.  I have a lot of fun and really enjoy most of the people I work with.

Strategic direction from leadership rarely lasted more than a year. Constant worry about layoffs due to multiple reorgs. Some of the most talented hard working people I have ever had the pleasure to work with.

Ricoh is losing contracts so they are constantly letting people go. They have you leave early every day sometimes you only work 4 hours- your at risk of losing benefits. Management is inconsistent and retaliatory. Promise raises to keep people on, but then don't deliver.

Was with the company for 20+ years they offered much in the way of training.  If you wanted opportunity and challenge they offered it.  While much of the Houston call center was released due to changes within the company I owe this company so much for all they did for me.  I wish them well and continue to wish them all the success.

Ricoh can be a good company to work for. There are many opportunities for growth but depending on which division of the company you're in will decide where you may have the most opportunities. I have had the opportunity to grow from within.
I really enjoy the travelling part of the job. I enjoy working overtime in the copy center, travelling to different cities in South Carolina, overtime pay as well
Great technology, horrible support system.  Sales position  had little to no commission,  unattainable goals, poor salary rate.
Good company to work for. Great Benefits. If you enjoy working in the legal department Ricoh is contracted by the best Law Firms. Your hands on with Secretaries and lawyers
Not a good place to work.  Was given a terrible salary right out of school and took this as my first position.  Switched managers on me immediately after starting.  Not a good environment.

Ricoh is an excellent place to work, there is a lot of changes going on, but it is a good company, with a great family balance.  I travel about every six weeks, mostly international.  When I was home, I was either finishing reviewing an audit and preparing for other audits.
Management was horrible. The only good thing about the job was you were working by yourself most of the day. I would not recommend anybody work for Ricoh!!!
I was very young working at RICOH and was only a mail room clerk, but the job was cool. Didn't really do much throughout the course of a day except for deliver mail through the building.
Work with bindery machinery. Print jobs. Ship out product. Mail runs on campus. Daily operations go pretty smooth usually. Work load is heavy sometimes but does help the day pass.

Good place to start a office entry type of environment. Learn legal  software used on a daily basis. Learn to solve client demands and acclimate to client based culture. Learn to multi-task and solve complicated tasks at the clients request. Learn regularly used programs in a wide used legal environment.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.
Not bad place to work if you plan on not wanting  to moving up.
n/a I have nothing good to say about this company other than, they pay well for a japanese company.no no no no no good !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I work for Ricoh for 3 months I was promised the position and a new manager came on site and decided that he didn't want to hire me but I was promised before he even came never missed a day of work always was on time I was back from lunch on time just a great employee so I don't like to be lied to or promised a job. And now that I look back you still got the same position open so that tells me that the company is not right and my job for Richo ended December 2018 and today's date is 05/08/2019. As a event specialist you still have this job posteda and how many months has been see this company is not right and it should be a law against people like this that have people to get them caught up with work and then say the contract has ended that's not good....
Job stability has been an issue for many, many years now.  The continuous lay-offs over the years has employee morale extremely low.  There really isn't any morale left.

Most boring job I ever been to, it’s very fast paced you keep scanning for straight 8 hours it was just bad the environment is ok but the job itself was just boring s nonstop job until you leave work, the best thing I liked about was the pay but I was working for agency. That pays me good not Ricoh to be Ricoh employee they will pay you $12 and to be honest the pay doesn’t match the work load you do all day just insane it was not for me and I felt weird among everyone there I guess because i was the only educated person there win people that don’t even have high school diploma so it was not the right place for me to be at not for me might be for other people but so far I was counting every minute to go home which bad
Managers will always find something to question or complain about your work

Japanese owned company whose pricing models often makes sales difficult. I managed a sales team and my bosses told me to tell my sales people and new hires this was a $100K per year job when in reality its a $35-40K per year job at best. I was given tasks with time limits to accomplish them and then the time would be shortened drastically. When the tasks were not completed inder the new time constraints, I was written up and counseled. After 1 year of trying to be honest with my sales people and figuring out what this company wanted with its ever-shifting priorities, I moved on. The benefits were okay, the salary was fine, the managers and company culture is awful.
Ricoh provides a good opportunity to learn multiple skills in the normal performance of your job.  The company encourages employees to consider alternative to complete tasks more efficiently.
The work is relatively easy, the locations you work at vary from casual to business casual. All-in-all, it's not a bad job for beginners, but not the greatest for those looking to advance.
Over all  good  .Job security better than financial companies.Benefits normal and   work culture better than other companies .Hoping it maintains this culture

Managers are helpful and the culture is cooperative. The work does have it's stressful moments especially during month end, quarter end and year end.  It's a great place to work and I highly recommend it.
depending on what type of day it is sometimes you will have a high call volume and others it will be low. The first thing I do is check to make all my IPA tickets have a tech dispatched to them
I was a on call after hours 24/7 every other week on copiers and rev retail machines not much time for a home life.

I would still be working there if the office that I was working out of had not relocated.  My supervisor and human resources were very understanding about my leave of absence. I was given a severance package at the end of my leave due to me being unable to return to work and the office relocating.
Terrible place to work, poor management, constantly changing goals, lying to employees, no respect from management for skills and experience, bad location for the office.
It was a great place to work. They hire me on from the temp angency I was working for when I was working there. So I think that was awesome nice of them

Management is not knowledgable on how to run a Warehouse, Warehouse Operations, Dealing with Drivers; Service personnel, or customers. Management not open to simple ways to Organize a Warehouse, Inventory Control or has NO SOP(Standard Operating Procedure) on the Warehouse Procedures. Unorganized organization!
It provided me a ton of experience and I was promoted 7 times in my 16 yrs. I got a ton of internal training and access to technology training from vendor partners which became valuable knowledge.
Lots of changes, zero job security unless you're one of the inner circle.  Outsourcing \ termination is rampant in various departments to save a buck.
Good company to work within. Great culture. Employees given opportunities to expand their role and responsibilities. Employees encouraged to see training to upgrade skill set.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

poor atmosphere and leads love to humiliate and demean their employees. They like to make you feel incompetent at all circumstances and will never thank or applaud you on a good job well done. This company has the most lawsuits in the state of California. Not a good company at all to work for.

Every time new execs are brought in, the entire direction of the company, the marketing strategies, etc. changes. Lays off large numbers of employees at least twice yearly. Many layers of management before anything can get done.
Very stable and benefits are good. Management is approachable. Encourages growth, but may be more challenging to grow within the company. Friendly co-workers.
OK place to work
It was hard to work through the internal politics. They are also trying to save a dying business, but not willing to make the necessary changes they need to make,

Ricoh is a good company to work for, when you are begining your career, it gives you the tools to, be able to manage your day to day life , because you are cross trained, in different aspect of the company.

Great training environment but hampered by lack of senior level management engagement. Unfortunately this company is still stuck in the 90's and 00's GE mentality that sacrifices customer service for short term savings. Great products and good people but they need to get out of the "cut your way to profit" mentality.
Ricoh is a well run company that gets direction from Japan and Japan Staff. The organization has closed its California Manufacturing facility and moved it to Georgia

My manager is great and has helped me with with planning and progressing my career with the company.  I fully understand that who you work for has a lot to do with your experience at the company, but speaking for myself, my manager and his manager have been fantastic to work with.

Ricoh management favors some employees over other employees whereas the company likes you then you shall get ahead and upper level management supports lower management to where they will throw an employee under the bus and not do anything anything about it. Pay does not meet today's standard of living here at Ricoh. They do allow you to take courses but has to parallel Ricoh's career path for you if favored here to get ahead, if not then  if applying here, do not, find another job where you can build upon your knowledge and skills, or else you get stuck in doing the same thing without advancing.
Ricoh is a good place to work. You can make a nice living, but you will work for it. The biggest drawback has been the restructuring over the past few years.
Don't know when they are going to shut down. They keep laying people off and the work environment is very unstable. Security is gone. They keep trying to push everything overseas.

SSR and Project Mgmt involved receiving, overseeing, and checking complex custom legal document jobs/graphics jobs, delivering them personally and invoicing afterwards.  Lots of client interaction, making sure jobs were satisfactory, addressing issues, carefully executing the project and checking for flaws.  Travel and manual labor in delivery involved.  Team effort often a part of projects which was really fun.  Traveling by foot and car throughout the city and surrounding counties was enjoyable.

On a daily basis I would deliver and install ink toners. I worked at a on-site location office and would travel to all surrounding clinics and hospitals that used our equipment. I would perform basic troubleshooting and light technician work to equipment.

Its difficult to assume someone's job and have the other remaining employees fully accept you. But after an initial time period they all begin to realize Ricoh management is a dishonest and incompetent group and you establish a bond with the client against them.

Most enjoyable part of the job is finish built a product and get approve from QA to ship finished product to customer And most displeasure is have to doing things for the boss advantages but not for the company. Too much buddy system, most workers afraid to speak out scare of losing their jobs

Management needs an upgrade. It is very hard to move up the latter and get promoted. There can be a lot of unnecessary drama. They ask for you to do a lot of things that aren't part of your job description and it's really hard to get a raise.
I enjoy working at the different site and learning new material every day.  the more skills you learn helps build your resume. looking forward to spending many more years and grow with Ricoh.

No loyal customer culture. Only wants to make the stock go up. Will trounce on small customers. It's all a numbers game. Machines are not very good. They run dirty because of non-existent research and development.
ok place to work

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.
Good company, but recently outsourcing all its positions.
Ricoh mangers are not very good. Need better managers that are familiar with what their employee positions are. Compensation for work done does not match.

The most enjoyable part of my job are the professionals that I work with and in making a difference for the customers/prospects that I call on. I also enjoyed having a home office which actually makes it more productive for my success.
My overall review of Ricoh is that it’s a farely easy job. The thing that would make it stressful is the management not working together and properly planing, also lack of training.

Good company with opportunities for advancement.  Can be a little behind the times in how they try to get each site operation to conform to standardized reporting, but they give you the opportunity to act independently and provide what you think the client needs.
Solid organization to work with.  Was best know for the strong R&D of products and cutting edge technology. Changes was constant year over year with high sales/growth targets
Good place to work n I also enjoyed working there .my break was too short didn’t have enough time to have my lunch. Beside that everything is fine. Thank you.

Work days not too bad. I learned how to troubleshoot problems with copiers. Management weren't too bad. Workplace culture was ok for the most part. The hardest part about the job was the pay. The most enjoyable part about the job was meeting new people.

You were micro managed by someone that really didn't have logistics experience or knowledge, yet insisted you do things their way. No sense of urgency, you had to be one of the good old boys to get anything done.
Upper management verbally agrees to things then when HR gets involved they run. They say anything to keep you here but nothing to protect the managers.
Training is extensive, management seem clueless, no team control everyone wants to be the manager and tell you what to do. They are laying off constantly

Ricoh has various types of customers requiring different services, mostly handling their print and mail operations. Most of my experience was working in the corporate office of Health Net, providing the printed material they needed.

Ricoh would be a great place to work for if they had better management. The turnover rate is too high and it's a very stressful job.  I recommend you working for Ricoh only if you are going to school.
This company is going through substantial reorganization with the intent to lower cost. What once was a fantastic place to be is no longer. Questionable ethics.
I have had a great time working here.

It is a very productive and enjoyable workplace with the customers and the employees. I've been with the company for 16 years and have worked in numerous departments. I've learned so much from working with this company.
Great advancement opportunities. Very employee centric workspace, taking care of their most important asset.
Really liked it here. Great opportunities for advancement or staying in the role you like. Top notch training. Segmented sales for healthcare & I really enjoyed that.
stressful, stressful This job cost me my peace of mind. I have no respect for this company on how they treat there employee's. No disrespect just being honest.
I enjoy working as. receptionist  at FDIC for 20 years as a contractor with RICOH. I enjoy answering the switchboard and helping callers with there questions

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

good benifits is all they have, this Company only cares about the big man they do not care about the little man of the company  never gives a bonus  complains to you if you get 1 hr overtime but make it manditory for you to work overtime on a big job twice a year.  only give a 1-3 percent raise .

The Director of Accounting is a boss, not a leader.  He gives orders, but little guidance.  He knows accounting but cannot build relationship with those that work for him.  There is very low employee morale.  People come to work for him for the pay but there is little enthusiasm for the most part.  He is not approachable even though he thinks he sits in his office and answers questions means approachable.  He has unfriendly demeanor and gives short answers.  He get irritated when people don't understand his response.

Overall, Ricoh USA is employee friendly in a difficult industry. Working as a contractor within another company. Challenges are constant, but can be managed with tools and assistance within the company.
There seems to be a lack of communication within the company. I think that there may have been a lack due to the contract in which individuals were placed. The work environment was pretty decent.
Loved the excitement. Hated the mess.. Work was Strategic and Training wasn't good for actual job.. Management was a cult and only cared for it's own...
The job was very stressful. Everything was about the numbers. Audits were very meticulous. The layed back atmosphere and flexible hours were a plus. Activities and Awards made it fun,
The work pace at Ricoh Electronics was a fast pace environment. The work was easy and required very accurate performance.Often times the machines malfunctioned.
