My responsibilities were varied and included overseeing exempt and non exempt call center employees. With approximately 135 resources working varying hours from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm Monday through Friday taking calls and managing off line work to include email and fax requests for service and supplies. High focus on employee development coupled with managing service levels to ensure quality customer service. Worked to secure appropriate staffing levels to meet service levels as well as a variety of HR and leadership duties.

The company was not a bad place to work. The environment and the pace of the work-place was just to slow for me. I like to work and be busy all the time basically from start to finish and I had to sit down for 9 hours.
Very good company and is interested in innovation in all functions and activities. Employees at every level are committed to making a difference every day for customers.
Decent company to work for. I learned a lot from this company and excelled in my field. The company offers good benefits and PTO and the assignments are not to bad at all.

Each year there has been turnover that effects the go-to-market strategy on fulfilling market needs because there is either a loss of intellectual property and skills or a lack of commitment to the company mission.  It changes yearly rather than giving a glide path of 3 to 5 years to see the efforts come to fruition.

I really enjoyed myself at Ricoh the first day I started it was like I connected wit everyone cause of how I work i just wish I could have got hired on but my assignment ended cause they started slowing down
This job was all about finding the right person to talk too. 4 days a week knocking on doors and making phone calls. working with all types of business
Working with people are lot of fun. Take time to help each other out is great thing. We have meetings every other week talk about how well the company is doing.
Busy

Comfortable atmosphere, fair turnaround expectations, reliable work volume. Site-level management very receptive and willing to work with employees. Work is generally contracted, and most difficulties stem from working with customers.

Ricoh has a lot of great benefits. I enjoyed the time I worked at Saint Francis Hospital through for 17 years. Working with Ricoh has been challenging and rewarding in the aspect of knowledge and  training development.
lower management great- upper management ahhh not so much. Too many people in charge, not enough employees. I have heard that the company is taking a turn in a better direction.

Ricoh would be a good company to work for if they had better management and good paying jobs. The level of stress is not worth your time and definitely not the pay.  I only recommend you working for Ricoh is you are going to school!

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

I was in the managed serviced dept meaning I managed a service for a client.  I had a lot of freedom in that regard.  You often felt like you worked for 2 companies (both RICOH and the client)  and had twice the amount of work to be done.  If you requested help or said anything they would send a helper to your site but they would often be poor quality.  60% of my helpers were not allowed back due to behavioral problems.

Looked forward to different challenges each day working as a facilities manager. If it wasn't something needing to be fixed, it was something that needed to get done for the building and or people. It was great working with all my colleagues and I enjoyed making therm happy by providing my best always. The hardest part of my job was not having all the budgets needed. The most enjoyable part of my job was getting things done with accomplishment and making  the building the best it can be.
Enjoyed dealing with customers and solving problems, always felt my co-workers had my back. learned to work as a team, learned computer skills as well as networking and mechanical skills
its a nice place to work...i worked so many years and had so many nice memories.
Typical day at work is working at a computer most of the day.

One phrase comes to mind: Bait & Switch. They'll make you think you are going to be and pay you as a 1st tier responder. Then all of a sudden you're writing manuals, coming up with site procedures, going to supervisor meetings, becoming a liaison between company and client, and then they'll assign crazy things like tier one computer maintenance while expecting you to be a freelance network engineer for their clients.

Ricoh has been a great place to work.  I really appreciated the flexible schedule as I am also a full time student in a masters program. The culture as well as the co-workers are pleasant   The hardest part about the job was dealing with the slow periods when it was difficult to secure business.
Not a lot of room for growth and a lot of layoffs, and not good annual increase.  They do have a good work life committee.   The company works hard at going green.

Ricoh was a joke. There was no culture. They treat their employees like peasants. There is no open door policy unless you don't like or agree with something. Then you are free to open the door, walk out and never return.

Some of the activities required by Ricoh are very counterproductive and do not allow Sales reps to focus on core responsibilities of selling, changes made by the company have limited our resources and make it hard to retrieve information in a timely manner.
A good company to work for.Helpful co-workers.Constant on the job learning.Valuable computer training.A good annual review process. I learned to do quality printing and copy work.
great work experience, but the management is very poor. i will not recommend anyone to work at ricoh. also never recieved my money for  2 employee referrals. HR claimed i wasnt used for referral.

Great reviews. Punctual and pleasant. Eager to learn. Enjoy working with others. Morning person and greeting of people every day. Love making a persons day and listening to issues and addressing them.
The work place was very nice and productive, all the co-worker are friendly and work like a team and we learn new things always that help a lot in our work development.

I loved this job and my managers. you can choose to get 3 week vacation, the opportunities are amazing and the knowledge and experience was amazing. The people are awesome to work with, you get to meet a lot of people because they have fulfillment specialist and they go from location to location doing different things.

Ricoh has made many changes over the last few years & continues to do so. They have outsourced many job functions & have sent others off shore. The overall morale is dropping & changes are coming too fast for employees to keep up.
There was a good experience working with people who wanted to make a difference as I do. We you have good team participation and a Zest to win. Thank you.
Ok company, changing environment from when I started.  Less personal feeling now.  Managers ate often expected to by 24/7 even though work life balance is preached.
It was a lot of paperwork. Quiet as it normally is there was still a negative attitude felt from the people there. Not very friendly. Very much a clicky environment
busy, mutli-tasking, imagine change, as it happened all the time.   Must be organized and stick to schedule provided for adherence measures.  Lean new processes daily, added work added with time.

Ridiculous schedules, poor management and they all answer to the clueless execs in Japan. Leaders are only looking out for themselves and constantly leave the grunge work for the worker bees with zero appreciation.

Ricoh is a company that will invest in your career.  They provide you all the tools you need to succeed, you just need to let your manager know where you want to go in the organization.  Most managers are not micro-managers, they let you run your accounts as if it's your book of business.  Support is always there if needed.

It is a repetitive, quick paced job position. The management did poor in communication but overall my manager was the best one. The workplace is not like any other warehouse. The hardest part of the job would be during the holidays in December.
There is a big turnover. No communication
If you had to ask me what the most common phrases I heard at Ricoh they would be the following:
It was a good place to work, they had great work life balance. You could be on committees where your feed back would count and be used to put things and events in place for all at the center to use.

Ricoh was a great place to work for a very long time, but has recently undergone a cycle of constant change and instability.  Many of the people who made it great have left and there is very little loyalty or opportunity for growth there anymore.
Fast paced day. Travel and repair. Most days spent going on site and repairing customer equipment. Also maintained inventory and spent time communicating with fellow technicians and vendors.
Manager and co-workers were great pay was not that great. Loved the fact that the location I was assigned it was generous to us and allowed us to participate in their celebrations.
Everyday is a new challenge. It is difficult at times, the users have a habit of breaking parts and getting mad that it costs to replace. High stress, low reward.

Poor management took all the fun out of working for them. I like working on the machines, but they want everyone to be a salesman. Managers work off a spreadsheet of numbers, instead of talking to the customers.

The Area Director lies and is a complete bully.  She only watches out for herself, does not follow policies unless it benefits her, and fails her immediate staff often.  Unfortunately, Ricoh is about money.  They lie to keep accounts, pay nothing to employees but, expect the same employees to stay with them and be loyal.  Raises were 1%-2% for 2018.  If you expect a career or good money working for Ricoh, look elsewhere.  This company is a joke!
Easy job to do, but they are more worried about the company than their employees. Just do your job, and maybe you’ll get a little raise at some point.

Working 3rd shift no room for advancement. Managers not properly trained. Lack of leadership. Very diverse. Laid back environment but there is still work to be done. I learned a lot and now know what to look for and how to handle situations in the work environment.

Working at Ricoh for almost 15 years was a very pleasurable experience. Rico provided a quiet room a game room and a lounge where you could get to know your coworkers. As with any cost center Rico was very fast pace with things changing from minute to minute so you had to be a quick thinker and be able to work without supervision to reach to go that was sent by management.

Ricoh is very big of work/life balance.  This helped a great deal and made it more enjoyable to be employed with them.  The great part about Ricoh is that you are able to be a remote worker and that continually helped with the sales for as well and the operations group.  Meaning you were able to dedicate your time faster during the work day.
outside of field service company is great as a field service tech life is very hard and stressful very little of any thing to get one up and motivated for another day
Ricoh was a decent working experience. The company provides you with the proper training do the task @ hand affectedly. You are rewarded for a job well done and properly.

The Work Environment at Ricoh USA, Inc. is trivial, but friendly in contrast with most Outsourcing Corporations. From a "Managerial and Co-worker perspective", there is usually someone at any designated "Work Site" who is willing and able to teach and train from viewing an online video exam and / or hands-on-training. We were encouraged not to be recalcitrant and unwilling to become "Multidimensional" and take Ricoh Cross Training School Courses, which increase work credentials and better future employment opportunities on a resume.

Overall I feel that the company really do not care about their employees. Every time you turn around there were layoffs, I worked here for very long time and I was part of the lay-off.You really do not know what is going to happen one day to another. If you have a family do not work for this company. Like the other person said over 1000 people were lay-off of nationwide.

I worked through a third party contractor (capital staffing) there for about 3 months and my main manager had to have open heart surgery so I got stuck with a nasty mean old lady. My supervisor was okay but rude too. They’re way too strict about their breaks. It’s a strike if you’re even a minute late back from break or a MINUTE LATE to work.
